name: Lincoln Home
address: 413 S 8th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: The street of Lincoln's house was closed which made it very pleasant and easier for taking pictures. Also, if the tour was full and couldn't get to go inside his house, you could still visit the neighbors' houses which were full of facts and preserved subjects. All for free. The parking was only a minute walk from the house, super convenient. Worth the time.

What a fabulous experience.   The whole block is managed by the National Park Service.   You have to go to the visitor's center to get tickets to go on the tour of the home, but it is well worth any wait.   Our park ranger was great and the tour was just wonderful.   We did a full review on our blog site and YouTube channel.

So, I love history. Especially American history. If you are like me or even just lukewarm on things like this, than I highly recommend visiting the Lincoln home. 

The tour guide was thorough and also quite witty. The house is in great condition and unlike Washington’s Mt. Vernon estate, photography and filming are both allowed inside the Lincoln home. I believe there was a very small cost associated with visiting the home. Maybe $2 and you get your tickets at this little Lincoln Home historic park site building not far from the home. This is also where you park and the $2 might only have been for the parking, my memory is unfortunately not clear on that any longer. 

It was quite a thrill picturing the Lincoln’s in their home for things like Christmas, birthdays etc. There is much of the inside and outside of the home that is original.

Love this place been there many times,with my Children when they were young and now with my oldest brother now that we're both retired. History in your face!.. You get to ponder the life of or greatest President and see were by he lived and loved his family! before the weight of the Presidency and the war to save are United states was placed upon him. The place were he was a regular guy... I recomend it for every American and a great place for foreign visitors to see what America is all about!

Fabulous place to take a tour. The rangers are nice and quite knowledgeable. If you go in the winter they put out furniture and objects that they don’t have out in the summer. There’s a movie, a quite expansive visitors center, and a gift shop as well. Parking is $2 per hour or you can use street parking.

name: Washington Park
address: 1501 S Grand Ave W, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: We live close by this park and we love it. It's beautiful to drive through during the holidays. The playgrounds are great for kids. A beautiful, clean park to enjoy. Can't wait for spring. What a gem.

Very cool place. The rose garden and greenhouse are not to be missed. Make sure you are paying attention to the signs when you drive in, it can be a little confusing getting around the one-ways if you are not paying attention.

One of my favorite places in Springfield. It's a great place for a walk the dog, jog, bike. Go for a short hike. Feed some ducks. And apparently fish. It has a decent size playground. Tennis courts and if your lucky you'll get to see a deer family.

Great place to do all kinds of family oriented activities and personal exercise. Wonderful large areas for picnics or even a peaceful place to relax and read or have personal time. Has great options of things to do and see throughout the park. Beautiful places for photography and weddings. The Carrollon is beautiful as well as the gardens around it. The large ponds are great for letting children feed ducks and catch n release fish. An all around great park within Springfield
BEAUTIFUL PARK!!! ITERTAIN YOUR SELF, JOGGING,WALKING,SITE SEEING? NICE HISTORICAL PARK.

name: Old State Capitol
address: 526 E Adams St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews:
I’d recommend visiting because this building is a snapshot in time. It was used for only a short period before the “new” state house was built. Also, it was built before electric or gas light, which is interesting to see from an architectural point of view (the windows are incredible). 
There’s a lot of interesting memorabilia and the staff is friendly. 
It would probably benefit from better signage but the staff is happy to answer questions and give the rundown on the building.

Amazing historical landmark! The place could use a little love on the maintenance end. I get that the building is older but they still have plenty of guests coming to visit and could stand to at least fix the stalls in the restroom. None of the stall doors locked properly and even had hand written notes to NOT lock them.

It is still a place that always leaves me in awe to think of the amazing history that was created there.

This was our first year visiting during the Christmas  season.We did a free carriage ride that provided warm blankets. We visited the Old State Capitol where  we were greeted by Santa and  Mrs Claus who handed out candy canes. Crafts and old fashioned toys for the kids to enjoy...hot cocoa and yummy treats as you walk down the streets. Smiling faces and Christmas cheer to keep you thru the rest of this year.

We stay the last august on our honeymoon. It was a very good hotel our stay was fantastic and they take care of every detail. It's a very good option here because not all the hotels are very good. I hope to go here for our other visits.

Very nice place. The art and the design of the building is superb. It has a lot of history while still being able to be modern. The old state capitol is also a good place to visit if you wanna see another piece of Illinois History. Easy parking and very nice staff.

name: Illinois State Museum
address: 502 S Spring St, Springfield, IL 62706, USA
reviews: The museum was amazing. My wife and I learned a lot from going there. We went about a hour before close and the museum was basically empty which was really nice because we were able to take lots of nice photos and spend as much time as we wanted at each part of it. I really wish we were able to see the full rock and rolled exhibit that is coming but we were only able to see part of it. Would recommend for anybody who enjoys museums to go here!

It is very easy to find a Lincoln related historical site in Springfield. You can basically find one on every corner. This museum is about all the history outside of Abe Lincoln. Which is a fantastic thing. This hidden gem of a museum is a must so for locals an visitors alike. The entrance fees are very reasonable and the value for the money is fantastic.
Museum after hours was a lot of fun! Had a good beer and learned about some new games from the folk at Titan Games. Good music as well!

Good place to visit for anybody who is interested in science or history. At the time of my visit the place was almost empty. Have been living in Illinois for a long time yet I learned a lot about history of this state. Some historical facts were actually very surprising for me.
Nice way to spend some time. My 2 kids liked the main floor. The upstairs is more for adults and the basement is now for small kids.

name: Washington Park Botanical Garden
address: 1740 W Fayette Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: The Washington Park Botanical Garden is a great way to relax and unwind. You will be able to see exotic plants indoors, walk through a rose garden, and be able to enjoy the Thomas Reese Memorial Carillon.
The park is amazing and the garden is beautiful. It was not as big as I thought it would be though it was relaxing and peaceful to walk around. I would go back again.

The staff at the botanical gardens are always ready and eager to accommodate our group. They set out tables the way we request and the exact number of chairs, while allowing us access to more if we need them. The kitchen is perfect for our needs, and the updates are gorgeous. I wish I had taken before and after pictures. Thank you, Springfield Park District and the Botanical Gardens staff for all you do for the Iris Society!
Great place to walk. Make sure to see the Greenhouse!

Building open 12-4. Grounds I would say are sunrise to sunset.  Grounds are immaculate.  Stunning. A public park which has no litter, graffiti, the paths are absolutely perfect.  or even a leaf out of place. Very Impressive.   (A drinking fountain or faucet would be nice.  Though the cold weather in winter likely makes such a desire unlikely.)

name: Southwind Park
address: 4965 S 2nd St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: I always forget about this place due to its location. You just can't see it from the major thoroughfares. That aside this is one of the nicest parks in the region. Ample parking. Clean and well maintained grounds. Room to spread out and run around. The pavillion is an added bonus for larger more formal functions.
Beautiful park! Great for pictures or for kids to play.

Love the place.. perfect for weddings or large group events! A few months ago we were able to have the suicide walk here and they let my group lead the way.. they supported us because the loss of our friend was still fresh so they wanted to do as much as they could for us. Its also a great place for kids to run around and play

Southwind Park is relatively new and very well kept. There are multiple playgrounds, a stocked pond, a splash pad and plenty of places to sit. Several pavilions offer space to gather and there are bathrooms that are clean and accessible. The paths in the past are smooth concrete, making it great for strollers, bikes, and wheelchairs. I feel like this is probably the best park in Springfield if you are in a wheelchair.
The downside to it is that this park is pretty out of the way, being on the southern edge of Springfield.
Great, big ,organized park. Many places for kids to play(grass and playgrounds) many pathways for walking. Very family friendly and safe place.

name: Dana Thomas House
address: 301 E Lawrence Ave, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: If you're visiting Springfield this is definitely a free fun tour to do. Although i recommend a donation for they rely on the generosity. Frank Lloyd Wright's architecture and eye for design is something you need to see for yourself. You also learn a lot about the house's history and how it is involved with Springfield. Ms. Dana has an amazing history of her own as well.
Fabulous example of Frank Lloyd Wright's architecture, beautifully restored.  Be sure to visit during the Christmas season when it's beautifully decorated for the holidays!

Beautiful architecture, great tour guide, a fun indoor activity for Springfield, IL. I like that the entry fee is a donation of your own choosing. FYI free parking is available specifically for the Dana Thomas house in a lot off of Cook St.

This place was super cool. I'm not a big architecture buff and I don't know much about Frank Lloyd Wright, but I loved this house. I would never want to live there b/c it's just not my style, but I so appreciated how integrated the house was together, how purposeful everything that was included was, and all of the architectural details and sight lines. And to think he built that style of house in 1902, people must have thought he was utterly insane. It looks so different from other stuff that was being built at that time.

The tour is well worth the time and the donation they suggest and I would highly recommend it to anyone in Springfield for a visit.

This home has been ingrained in my memory ever since I took my first tour 10 years ago. It is a magnificent home and a true treasure. It goes without saying that FLW was a remarkable architect and it is evidenced by this house. This is treat for any person who loves architecture in any form. In addition to the house, the woman behind it was very interesting and I loved the information you learn about her on the tour. This is a MUST when coming to Springfield.

name: Lincoln Memorial Garden and Nature Center
address: 2301 E Lake Shore Dr, Springfield, IL 62712, USA
reviews: A great place for nature walking and enjoying Lake Springfield. There's enough trails that it never feels crowded. Possible to see deer.

Took a long walk around the property. Estimate 10,000 snow geese on the lake. Awesome sight! Visitor center was fun to visit. Staff was knowledgeable and nice to visit with. A good thing to do on a sunny winter day!

For what it has and what it is, it does it well. Navigable trails of mostly wood-chips. Along the lakefront. Picnics allowed. Restrooms in nature center during open hours and in prairie area. NO DOGS (try Carpenter Park).
Nice garden area with multiple trails.  The Visitor Center was pleasant and staff was helpful with maps and interesting information about the history of the area and suggestions for future visits.
It was very nice! The weather was perfect for it! Our girl scout troop was very happy.

name: Lincoln Home National Historic Site Visitor Center
address: 426 S 7th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: If love history and learning about what it might have been like in Abraham Lincoln's time, this is definitely a most see in Springfield.  It's very well preserved and they make it fun to walk about  on the wooden sidewalks  in the  area. It was  a beautiful perfect day when I went.  It's very charming.

Fantastic place to visit.  When someone thinks of visiting Lincoln's home you will be surprised to find more than just the house that he lived in.   Because this historic site has 2 blocks of preserved homes (with some people dressed in period clothing) you have a feeling of going back in history.  The only thing I would like to see is to have each historic home being furnished with period furnishings.  A number of the homes were filled with signs and photos  explaining some of the history.  Lincoln's home was filled with Lincoln's belongings and furniture - very nice!!
Great place to go by yourself or a family outing. Love walking through the old houses. Good way to destress thinking about older, simpler days. Rich in history.

The only home that Abraham Lincoln ever owned is truly a national treasure. We are so lucky in Springfield to have this.  We can thank Robert Lincoln for it being free most other national parks to my shock when I visited them.  We can thank Robert Lincoln for it being free most other national parks to my shock when I visited them charge you to visitIn 1887 when he gave it to the State of Illinois he stipulated that no fee would ever be charged.  Is a joy to visit and the visitors center and the surrounding neighborhood always have something interesting and new to tell us.  Here there are various special programs including trick or treating and other speakers and activities.

The well-preserved home and neighborhood of the best president this country ever had. The man devoted to saving this great nation once lived here as a lawyer, and his house is open for tour. Great, isn't it? Anyway, hit the visitor center to learn about all things Lincoln, and you may even get to hear a speech by a great Lincoln impersonator. I thought I was hearing the speech from the man himself. A great experience!

name: Elijah Iles House Foundation
address: 628 S 7th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Our host was so delightful as she took us through the entire house, pointing out all the important details and the assorted household items. We learned about the founder of Springfield, Senator Iles, while touring his 182 year old house. It has been preserved so well.

Beautiful!  A great place to visit. A nice addition to the preservation of Lincoln's life and time in Springfield, IL.

**Note: Lincoln's birthplace is actually in Kentucky.
There is also a museum of Illinois Watch Company in the basement of the house.
A unique glimpse at living in early Springfield and an amazing clock and watch museum downstairs.
An amazing glimpse of the lives of Springfield's earliest residents.

name: Knight's Action Park
address: 1700 Knights, Recreation Dr, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: We had a great time! Would've been better if fully staffed & everything open! (I LOVE paddle boats. (It was closed.) I hate seeing kids pulling double duty on a "fun" summer job!)

My 6 year old loves Knights! Especially the wave pool and kids slides. It's just big enough that it has never been super crowded and there are life guards everywhere. They offer some really good deals on admission tickets thru their website which is helpful when you're paying admission for several people. Would like to see lockers placed throughout the park instead of just the entrance. Overall, we love spending our summers at Knights!

One of my most favorite places in the world! The whole family can hang out here, regardless of age, and feel safe and have fun and meet all kinds of new friends. I look forward to Knight's every year!

I used to buy season passes every year until 2011. Then I can back to visit for the summer. We got the passes again. We have been 4 times so far. It has been great for my 2 year old. The park has an area for everyage to play.  They have 7 slides for bigger kids. Wave pool splash kingdom, paddle boats, seal bay, and lazy river. They have 5 dinning areas. They also have a bar with video gaming. They have golfing and batting area as well. Food and drinks are expensive but good. Bathrooms in the water park are gross!!! Slush mud water all the time. The front lobby bathrooms  ear arcade are nice and clean. The kids have fun everytime we go!! Season passes are worth every penny.

We get season passes every year. If you go four times it usually pays off the pass.

Staff is very friendly and helpful.

The only thing that stinks is it's crowded on super hot days.

name: Illinois State Military Museum
address: 1301 N MacArthur Blvd, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Awesome museum that is a best kept secret.  And today with all the reenactors putting on trench skirmishes, and the professor giving a great informative lecture, and the couple from a Wheaton museum that shared their wares and info....it was a great day!
Really great display of fabulous military articles. Truly impressive.

We are so glad we stopped in. Truly a very nice museum with informative artifacts and collections from the various wars. The location is off the beaten path but it's absolutely worth it. Our 3 kids were engaged and asked interesting questions about each exhibit. The museum is continuing to expand and add new items. Excited to support this museum and our veterans who take the time to engage with students in educational workshops and tours.
Great museum and awesome hosts for the 29th anniversary of the end of Operation Desert Storm.

Great museum. We learned so much while visiting. Had a good question and answer session with an actual helicopter pilot that was so nice. The museum is done well and informative. I would recommend checking this place out. Donation requested, other wise it's a free museum.

name: Abraham Lincoln Presidential Museum and Library
address: 112 N 6th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews:
To be clear- the law office and the presidential library are at different locations. The law office is at the old state house plaza. 

The law office building has been meticulously restored, and the re-created law office and post office are now located on the ground floor. 
I’d say this is a must see for lawyers; I would recommend it to everyone since it is not large and quick to see. 
There is also a Springfield/ Lincoln visitor center at the law office location.

Very well done museum.  From Lincoln's early years to the very end, the displays we're well out together and interesting.   Easy to spend 3-4 hours.   Although, at the time of my visit, the sculpture in front of the museum was rather odd, I did learn about the back story, so it made more sense.  I would say kids under 10 might not be so interested.    Also, if short on time, start with the White House years.

Both moving and deeply felt, the A Lincoln Pres Museum does not merely portray his presidency. It shows us, in depth, the path Lincoln took from his youth to old age and the making of America's bold, steadfast civil wartime president and how he kept the union together. Be prepared to be challenged, be enlightened and be galvanized by the undying memory of our 16th president.
Loved how the Museum was set up. Very informative and interesting.

The Presidential Museum is beautiful!!!! A perfect tribute to our beloved President Lincoln!!!!! But l do have a couple of suggestions for improvement if l may! Let's get real here let's keep the political correctness out of this museum built in honor of the Greatest President of the United States of America and the greatest human being that held this office!!!! Why isn't there any displays of Civial war firearms and sword's in the room were all the verious Civial war uniforms are displayed? After all the Civial war wasn't fought by throwing rocks at each other!!!!! The other thing is the room where the President is laying in state! The casket, the funeral tent the lights everything is right on with the picture except There should be  a wax figure of President Lincoln's body in the casket and two Civial war soldier's standing by the casket!!!! Every major city from Washington DC to Springfield the funeral train stopped where  he layed in state the casket was open!!!! This is just reality and constructive feedback!!!!!

name: Thomas Rees Memorial Carillon
address: 1740 W Fayette Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Tour of the Carillon is well worth your time. You learn a lot. Thanks for the tour, Ethan!

A beautiful memorial in the Washington park area near the botanical gardens.  The music with the bells is amazing and plays quite often.  A good place to bring the kids and pets for a walk, and sunset is especially clamoring if you're looking for a good date around town.  The fountain is dormant now but should be running soon (currently it is may)

We took the kids to hear the free carillon concert at 1pm. It's a very nice park with plenty of benches and gardens to wander through while listening to the bells. There is also a video screen at the base of the bell tower so you can see the carillon player during the concert. Tours of the tower are available for a small charge when the bells aren't being played. This was a fun little break from all the historical attractions in town.
Concerts are awesome in the summer time and such a great sound to hear while walking in the park.

We were lucky enough to be in Washington Park when the Carillon was open for tours.  The tour guide was very gracious and patient with our children, in addition to being very knowledgeable.  The tour is succinct, delivering interesting information in an appropriate length of time.  We would highly recommend it for anyone seeking to know a bit more.

name: Air Combat Museum
address: 835 S Airport Dr, Springfield, IL 62707, USA
reviews: All the aircraft in this museum as airworthy and restored in immaculate and pristine condition. So worth the time to go see it!!

This is a place right near the Lincoln tomb so if you are visiting the tomb swing by this place. This is someone's connection that they are sharing with the public and wow it is a fantastic collection. It is free to enter but you can make a donation if you wish to. They had some cute cats running around and they just laid on the floor in front of me wanting to be pet. Some of the planes are open that you can sit in and take pictures. I will come here again that's for sure.  This is on my list of places to see in Springfield if you are there... check it out. Any questions just ask!

While in the area to tour the Lincoln Monument, we saw the Air Combat Museum on the map and stopped by.  What an interesting working museum! The young man, sorry I can't recall his name, was extremely knowledgable of the history and/or a story of each plane, and there are quite a few.  A a mixture of aircraft-Mustang;  one of the last, if not the last air worthy Corsair; a MIG, an acrobatic plane and several others.  Thanks for keeping the history alive!
It's a real treat to see this especially right here in Springfield. Good job 👍

Jeff Kromer is the best.
So knowledgeable, so generous of his  time.
Thank you sir.

name: Springfield and Central Illinois African American History Museum
address: 1440 Monument Ave, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: The place was a little small but full of great historic information. The guide was very nice and knowledgeable she made sure we received all the information and answered any questions we had. We will definitely have to come back.
It's a great beginning. But, it needs more stuff, and more contributions.

The staff here are not your ordinary museum staff but great historians in thier own right. I'm proud of my home town for having grown enough in culture & diversity to even have this museum in the first place. African-american history is history. There should be no separation or distinction necessary and it's just as important for non African Americans to know true all inclusive history as it is for us.
Great exhibits, especially the ones dedicated to African Americans in early Illinois. Had a great experience, and I definitely left with a desire to learn more.

I attended the grand opening in the summer of 2018. ILLINOIS has a particularly profound African American history that changed the course of the country and thus the world. From President Abraham Lincoln, to President Barack Obama and the nasty 1908 race riot, the catalyst for the NAACP, providing legal protection against racism. This museum offers this history, in addition to special events, such as the annual gala honoring local contributions to the community.

name: Union Square Park
address: 500 E Madison St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: This is a cute little park in the middle of town, with statues, benches, a bench with a sitting Lincoln statue, pretty landscape and furnishings, plus the picturesque Union Station as a backdrop. Can't go wrong for a place to hang out for a rest or chat.
Very beautiful! A must see! If been to any older city like in the east coast this a must visit!
Shady, cool & restful.
This remodel was very well done. Beautiful landscaping. Great stop before or after visiting the museum.
This is a small urban park designed mainly to just chill in which from personal experience does just that.

name: Springfield Art Association/Edwards Place Historic Home
address: 700 N 4th St, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: So amazing how much they care about the arts in Springfield!
Had a great time! Thanks Poppy 😁

We just had our wedding ceremony at Edwards Place and they were fantastic to work with. Very flexible with requests and prompt in responses to emails and calls. The venue presents a stunning setting with the rich colors and antiques. Our guests were wowed by it. I highly recommend working with them!
Really, really awesome! So much going on and tons of ways to get involved! Love it!

This place is a fun combination of local artists, and local history. One side was the Springfield Art Association, and they had a gallery setup with pictures and sculptures from local artists. Walk through the next door and you are in the historic Edwards family home. They actually have the courting couch that Mary and Abe sat on together.  There are certain pieces that have been completely restored, others from the time period, some the actually belong to members of the Edwards family, and then you have the fun game of the wallpaper. Pieces of the original that are still there, right next to the accurately recreated brand new wallpaper. It's fun and shows just how much time they have taken to restore this home.

name: Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception
address: 524 E Lawrence Ave, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews:
An absolutely beautiful Cathedral of the Roman Catholic Church, the Diocese of Springfield in Illinois. It is the home of our Bishop Thomas John Paprocki. I would invite anyone interested to attend one of the Masses held there either on weekdays or weekends. 
Easy access. Friendly parishioners. Close to downtown. 
I'm not well versed in church design, so I can't describe it properly. Well worth the effort to see.
I'm not a Catholic or anything, but I came here to see my boyfriend perform a trombone piece. The building was absolutely amazing to observe with beautiful at architecture and acoustics.

This is Mother Church of our diocese.   The windows are filled with beautiful stain glass windows.  One that includes Abraham Lincoln.  A great place for Mass, and prayer.  The Masses and ceremonies with the Bishop are always a very impresive.
Beautiful, restful small cathedral.

A beautiful, restful place of prayer. Confessions and Mass are offered daily. Sometimes I enjoy just coming to sit and pray in the middle of a hectic day. For the art inclined, the mosaics are okay but the windows are worth a stop. Many depict events in the history of the diocese and have themes and images somewhat unexpected for a church.  The organ was just refurbished and offers great, full sound to accompany either Mass or one of the concerts offered in the space.

name: Vachel Lindsay Home
address: 603 S 5th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Lovely historic home, they also host social events and camps
Pure Frank Lloyd Wright, way ahead of his time
Who doesn't love poetry?
The staff know their stuff. If you are a literature buff or just dabble with poetry, I would highly recommend checking out the "poets in the parlor" events!
Hidden treasure in Springfield

name: Proud Raven Totem Pole
address: 101-199 W Edwards St, Springfield, IL 62756, USA

name: Margery Adams Wildlife Sanctuary
address: 2315 E Clear Lake Ave, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Great nature preserve. Fun to walk or just sit and see what shows up at the feeders.
It was peaceful

Was there for a wedding. The site has adequate parking for a small party. The conference room we used had a bank of floor to almost ceiling windows so we could enjoy the many birds feeding at all the various feeders just outside. Acoustics for speaking were very good. Facilities (bathrooms, kitchen, etc.) were very good.
Lived here all my life and never knew these trails existed.  Less than a mile from downtown it is a great place for a relaxing walk.
Great place to take a walk with your pets.  Lots of nature

name: Lincoln Park
address: 1601 N 5th St, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: A really great place to walk.  There is a playground area, with picnic areas.  There is a beautiful pond with fish, turtles, and frogs.  There is also an exercise area at the top of the park.  A lot of all weather exercise equipment on a nice cushy flooring.  Once the weather warms my family and I plan to use the equipment.

Good place to visit for anyone who is interested in history. There was a very knowledgeable guide inside the Lincoln Memorial. Clean restrooms are on the left side of the parking by the Memorial. The whole cemetery seems to be old and worth walk around; lots of old grave markers. Some of them are so beautiful like the museum quality art and seem out of place, like those few ancient Greece style columns on the other side of the drive leading to the parking lot. The cemetery is, in my opinion, well kept.
This was a beautiful stop. Clean bathrooms. Well kept lands. Playground is great for toddlers and bigger kids.  The pond area is peaceful and well kept.
Lincoln Park is peaceful and spacious. Great open spaces, ponds, playgrounds, ice rinks and all the rest. Best disc golf course in the city (in my opinion).

It's just really nice to go sit by the water they have ducks and little waking areas, they have a park and gazebos to have cook outs.... Allot of people go use it to exercise bike, walk , run. Then you have the Nelson center there too with the pool open during the summer and the ice rink is all year round

name: Grand Army of the Republic Memorial Museum
address: 629 S 7th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Not as widely known as the other Land of Lincoln stops, this wonderful museum pays beautiful and honorable tribute to those who have served our country both on the front lines and at home when the wars were over in support of those who served. Please stop in. Give a donation.

Definitely not what I expected. This is a museum run by people who have a passion for the Grand Army of the Republic. See all sorts of civil war memorabilia. Ask questions. Learn something new. I highly recommend visiting this gem.
Really nice museum, just down from the Lincoln home
enjoyable 30 minutes
A really small museum, run strictly by volunteers and donations, which honors Civil War vets.  Check hours and days open.

name: Stuart Park
address: 1800 Winch Ln, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Great area to socialize your pet.
Great place to bring your pups....
A very nice place to visit.  For man and four legged friends alike.
We had a blast at the dog park for Halloween fundraiser for APL a couple of weeks ago.
Great place to let your dogs run and have a good time

name: Iles Park
address: 2000 S 6th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Nice park. I walk through here from time to time.  If I live closer I would visit more.
Great pickleball courts.
Very good park to go to  been around it for 25years 👌
Pickleball Heaven!

Iles Park is a place for everyone...tennis courts, pathway for walkers or bikers and a play area for children and big kids alike. There are swing sets and plenty of area to soak up sun and do your own thing. The park is located on a main street the play area is about a 100 ft away. I love it because its near me and not only do I play catch with my son/daughter...I can watch my 5 year swing her heart out on the monkey bars (their actually short enough)

 So yes Google I visited quite a few times and I always have a great experience today was worth writing a review...thanks for letting me know, you know, where I am......all the time!

name: Lincoln Depot
address: 930 E Monroe St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Small and free piece of history that shares space with a law office (upstairs). Self guided. Takes no more than 15 minutes. Grab a pamphlet of Lincoln's speech he made at this place before leaving for Washington DC. It's a moving speech. Depot is a 5 minute walk from the Lincoln home National historic site.

This is the place Lincoln departed from as he headed to take his appointment as President. It's a humble museum worth visiting. It smells really nice. You will get to see what a train station looked like back in the day and a cool safe which survived two fires.
Party of Lincoln Memorial Museum ticket fee and exact replica of what did in his day.
It's small but easy to get to and tour inside at your own pace
Awesome job by the Noll Law Firm preserving this historic place and making it freely accessible to the public.

name: Southern View Community Park
address: 3483-3499 S 4th St, Southern View, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Great park! Everything you need for baseball, soccer, volleyball. Covered picnic tables with grilling and bathrooms! Best family oriented park in Springfield.
Pretty park. Well maintained. Often lots of wind, so probably good for kite flying.
So much to do here. Attended a Family Reunion and the park has something for everyone. Nice restrooms, pavilions with electricity, ball diamond, open space, pond, walking path! Very clean.
Great park for the kiddos. While there I can get my poke stops for my game.  Plenty of things for the kiddos to play on.
Fun.

name: Lincoln's New Salem
address: 15588 History Ln, Petersburg, IL 62675, USA
reviews: A perfect evening for the annual Candlelight Walk! All of the volunteers were so welcoming and helpful throughout the evening. Excellent narratives from the individuals dressed in period costumes located inside each cabin open for the night. The paths and cabins were illuminated with candles and each cabin had a cozy fire burning in the fireplace. I thoroughly enjoyed the entire evening. Highly encourage people to visit Lincoln's New Salem. A great place to take your family for an educational tour.
Absolutely LOVE this place! Even if you are not an admirer of Mr. Lincoln (but let's face it---what sane person is not???) this is a fabulous peek into our past.

I've been visiting/volunteering at the site since I was a freshman in college. There's something magical about it. You've just stepped back in time. It's indescribably peaceful. Even on the busy festival weekends and special events like the annual candlelight walk.

One of my all time favorite places. This is true Americana. The aura and the spirit of pioneer times is present in the air, and it is a most peaceful place to be. 'Twas a joy to perform at the beautiful indoor amphitheater.

I've always received a warm reception from the the people of this area. There is a down to earth mentality and a charm not commonly found in other places. If you're looking for quality photography subject matter, a stroll through New Salem State Park will provide you with plenty of opportunity. The original town was faithfully reconstructed from the recollections and assistance of original residents. There are even a few areas that are yet original (such as the Cooper Shop).
Awesome time in Lincoln’s New Salem. I enjoyed looking at all the buildings and seeing how it would of been living in the 1860’s. Very friendly staff with a lot of rich history!

name: Pearson Museum
address: 801 N Rutledge St, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Loved it! Very interesting exhibits!
Awesome^

name: Ergadoozy
address: 1320 S State St, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Wild and crazy indoor play place. Clean enough. Really helpful owners who enjoy what they do. Several themed play areas catering to different age groups. Had a couple buses full of field trips when we went, which was a bit overwhelming for all involved. Overall, it was a good experience. Definitely worth your time if you have young kids and support small business.

We had a great time at Ergadoozy! This was our first time visiting and my daughter, who just turned one, loved it! We paid $10 for her and the adults were free. Your pass also lasts all day, so you can leave and come back! I was a little worried that there might not be stuff designed for that early of an age but they have 3 areas specifically for toddlers. She especially loved the "under 3" rollercoaster! Will definitely be back!

Lots of toys. Lots off collections. Lots of toys to buy. Lots of learning. Party rooms. Fun fun. Love this place. For $30 you can get a summer pass for June July and Aug. Great way to stay cool and have fun!!

Awesome place for the kids to go and play until they are exhausted.  We've spent fun days here and had birthday parties... works great for kids 3-12!  Staff was great and the party room rental is worth the price (especially when you factor in the food).
This place was so fun. My 3 year old loved it. They have a lot of great stuff in their gift shop too.

name: Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum
address: 212 N 6th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Absolutely outstanding presidential library. I have been to about eight of them, and always enjoy seeing new ones. This was a real treat, and they were very honest with their depiction of his work and life. The movie they show was fascinating and very informative. The displays were professionally done, and the staff was very friendly. LOVE this place! Makes you feel proud to be an American!

This is such a fantastic place to visit- for families, history buffs, or anyone looking for a good time. The exhibits are interactive and eye catching. Replicas of rooms and scenes are so similar to the places they represent! The wax figures are so well crafted. They capture an amazing likeness!!  The ghosts of the past show is AMAZING! Everything is included in one price. Student, veterans and senior discounts are available. Bathrooms are clean and accessible for handicapped and baby care. There is a restaurant inside, but I did not go there. Staff are very friendly also. A total win for our family!

This library and museum is amazing.  There are many exhibits including one holographic presentation that makes you believe President Lincoln is actually there.  I really enjoyed walking through history here.  Parking might be a little difficult but the area is worth exploring.

Really a terrific experience! Presents a pretty fair story of Lincoln and his family. Exhibits are impressive and experiential. Ample parking is available in a ramp about a block away. And don't forget that your museum ticket also gets you into the railway station right across the street!

The Lincoln home and old state capitol are an easy walk away.

Insider tip: DO NOT SKIP the "Ghosts of the Library" show at the Lincoln Museum. It's interesting and quite powerful!

Very good museum.  Comprehensive of Lincoln, but overall felt short, granted we didn't watch the two "movies". It's clean, costs about $15 for a ticket, 5 for a kid 5.  Lots of stuff about slavery and war, so if you've got kids be ready!

name: Indian Hills Park
address: 2536 Miami Trail #2500, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: awesome  area very clean  and pretty
Robert's Cub Scout Pack 53 marched here and picked up any trash on the way there and back to St. Aloysius school. They had a great time.
They have a tennis court.
I used to walk my dog in the park never have any problems.

Baseball diamond, Tennis courts with small parking area.  Baseball diamond good condition.  Tennis courts useful with moderate cracks, reflective of IL politics & defunding of anything healthy. Practice wall! Pickup games possible!  Lots, and lots of walking space for you and your dog.

name: Walnut Street Winery
address: 309 S Walnut St, Rochester, IL 62563, USA
reviews: Great staff, stage, and ambiance. The  red Sangria was pretty good, bit the rest of the wone was not the greatest. They do have a full bar, though.

Great wines and Loren the owner was great. It was just the 2 of us and another couple also having a tasting so we got Loren's undivided attention. He took us back and showed us the room they make the small batch wines in. They have several fruity wines and we liked everything we sampled so we bought a case.
Great place to go and relax. Great wine!

We had the Razzle Dazzle chocolate raspberry port it was fantastic then we had a cheese which had garlic and I don't remember what other my sister picked it out and it went great with the wine loved it

In the span of 5 minutes and within 7 minutes of meeting the owner, he gleefully and unsolicititously shared two rumors with me about two different people in my life. One was egregiously slanderous and the other was willfully spiteful. It seems he is vying for a new franchise of Real Housewives.

name: Clayville Town Historic Site
address: 125 Co Hwy 9C, Pleasant Plains, IL 62677, USA
reviews: We rented the barn and cabin for our wedding and it went perfect

Accompanied first grade class on field trip.   Educational experience at appropriate grade level and lots of hands on activities including attending one room school house, making a yarn doll, collecting eggs and dressing up.  Class had a blast.
We visit Clayville often for their events and be have had private events there for various organizations we are involved in. It's a wonderful venue.
Very cute place full of fb history. Not open very often, but when it is, it is great!!
It had great history and things for the kids to do.

name: Camp Butler National Cemetery
address: 5063 Camp Butler Rd, Springfield, IL 62707, USA
reviews: Always an honor to visit.  I have two sets of great-grandparents buried here.
Pristine Grounds , well maintained .
Because that's where my mom and dad were laid to rest

Well kept great staff honorable treatment of our military.  There is a section of civil war era graves is interesting for those who love history.

It is open 7:30 to sunset and is easily accessible throughout the year.  One of the finest institutions in the US that cares from our Veterans at the end of their lives.

My Mother and Her Parents Are Buried here. I have a Sweet Little Nephew Buried here as Well. And they are Always Remembered.  There are other Friends and Family here as well. So many to say. I come to visit each time I am in Illinois as are Home is in Florida. It's a Peaceful Place and Always looks So Nice every time. The Name Should Stay The Same as Always. It's Well Known from Way Back. It's a Name Well Given. Miss you all and Love you Deeply. Susie and Jimmy.

name: Lincoln Monument Association
address: 1500 Monument Ave, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Another item on our bucket list.   This monument is taken care of extremely well.   The association does a wonderful job.   Take your time when you are here and look around, take it all in.   Make sure you down below behind the monument and see the receiving vault as well.   We have a full review on our blog site and YouTube channel for this location.

Nice free place to visit. Does not have to take very long if you don’t want to. Awesome place to pay respects to Abe Lincoln. Lots of Pokemon stops all around here, too, if you or your kids are into that.

Very stunning monument and tomb for the greatest President the United States has ever had.  Everytime I enter the tomb, I am always humbled by its history, architecture, and greatness.  

I've been coming here since I was a kid as I have several relatives buried in another part of Oak Ridge.  I would like to see the upper level of the tomb opened again.  It's has been closed off to visitors for several years.

Lincoln Memorial Association takes care of Lincoln Memorial and I think they do good job. One of the members was inside at the time of my visit; very knowledgeable old man. It was a pleasure to have a little conversation. The Memorial seems to be in a good shape and open for visitors; I would not expect more...
Maybe I'm strange but this is probably the most beautiful cemetery I've ever visted. The inside of the tomb is just gorgeous. It would also be great for a scary movie though, LOL

name: Scovill Zoo
address: 71 S Country Club Rd, Decatur, IL 62521, USA
reviews: Only gave a 4 star because they weren't open. But, looks amazing and entertaining.  Appeared to have a good variety of species too. :) Prices were very affordable!!!
Great little Zoo w lots of animals n rides for adults n kids. I love the train ride. Great place to spend the day
What a lovely zoo! We went in October 2019 and enjoyed every moment. Lovely customer service
My whole family loves this local zoo.We have a family membership and go at least once at week when it's open! My preschooler loves learning about the animals and getting to know them.
Love zoos. This one didn't disappoint. Enjoyed the train ride. Recommend.

name: Illinois State Police Heritage Museum
address: 4000 N Peoria Rd, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: I real like the lllinois state police it real cool jon Ferguson
Thursday and Saturday 11 am to 1 pm.

name: Children's Museum of Illinois
address: 55 S Country Club Rd, Decatur, IL 62521, USA
reviews: My son loves this place. We can spend hours here several times a week. The membership is definitely worth it!

It can be a lot of fun for older kids (5ish and up) but the toddler section is so tiny with so little to do. For a place with so much learning available, I expected more than puzzles and books in the toddler area. If they would add more for under 2-3 years old, we would love to take our daughter.
My 5 year old could have easily spent all day here. She kept bouncing from exhibit to exhibit but could have done it all day and not cared. It wasn't too crowded when we went
My child had a blast.  It was fun and entertaining. I wish there was some music playing, that would have been awsome
Beautiful day for a walk. Saw flowers budding in Sculpture park.

name: Looking for Lincoln Heritage Coalition
address: 1 N Old State Capitol Plaza, Springfield, IL 62701, USA

name: Illinois Fire Museum
address: Central Ave & Main St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Decent display of our fire service history.  The State of Illinois is allowing the building to go into disrepair...very sad.  Volunteers at the museum were very nice.  Kids liked the interactive displays.

name: Edward A. Trudeau, M.D
address: 340 W Miller St, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: One of the best doctors I have ever had the pleasure to interact with..and just a very down to earth gentleman. .5 stars plus..
Dr. Trudeau is very kind, gentle, caring, funny, and compassionate.  If you need an EMG, he is the doctor to see, the test was quick and painless. Highly recommend!

Dr. Trudeau is the Best at what he does, he knows his equipment an exactly where he needs to go to get you the very best results on your testing. He and his staff is curtious  and very professional, an it’s all done with a sense of humor to get you through the test. It’s over before you know it, I can truly say this was one doctor appointment that I really enjoyed. 
He sent the results to my doctor very quickly an had everything my surgeon needed for my surgery. 
Months down the road my case turned into one that was something totally unexpected. I had a allergic reaction to one of the anesthesia’s used in surgery so it had to be stopped to get blood pressure back up. This was turning into a nightmare trying to figure out where an who to see to get the testing needed to finish my surgery. 
Bamm, I told my wife I’m calling Dr. Trudeau he’ll know what an where to call. So called the office an Bobbie answered, I told her who I was an she remembered. She let me know that  the doctor was at the hospital with patients an she would have him call me back. That evening Dr.  Trudeau called after Bobble told him what had happened to me. 
Dr was quick to give me guidance to get me on my on my feet again. He also advised me on how serious it is to get this resolved. 
I can’t begin to to tell you how relieved I was getting his call that night. He’s probably one of the most caring doctors you will ever meet ! 
I told him when I got fixed I’m coming back to take him to lunch, it’ll be my pleasure just to visit with him again. 
Sincerely,
John Shallenberger

Dr. Trudeau is a wonderful doctor.  He is thorough, precise, and he takes his time to provide his patients eith the upmost care.  Most of all he puts his patients at ease by thoroughly explaining tests right down to the tiniest detail.  I can honestly say that I actually enjoyed my appointment which is a rare, if not non-existent.
Dr Trudeau is one of the best dr I have met, he is so down to earth , understands the patients problem. I will never forget him, you are awsome dr Trudeau !

name: Sky Zone Trampoline Park
address: 3454 Liberty Dr, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: The place is fun, and we’ve been to (and had) multiple birthday parties here. We have young kids, so my biggest complaint (this my rating) is the lack of adherence to rules for toddler time. Most parents are minimally active (as appropriate) but some dominate the play time reserved for toddlers. It’s as if it’s their time. Staff don’t enforce the rules and I’ve seen kids get landed on and tripped up by parents jumping into pits and on trampolines. It’s toddler time people. Let the kids play...safely.
Took one of my son's for his birthday the other brother said that he had the best time😁
Attended a Christmas party with the grandkids. They had a great time. Nice facility for kids.
Great for young people. Great place to have a birthday party.
My son had his birthday party there and it was great. The pizza was surprisingly good.

name: Kidzeum of Health and Science
address: 412 E Adams St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews:
We have taken out girls (3yrs old and 5yrs old) here 3 or 4 times now. We went ahead and bought the year family pass this time.

I am very happy that we have something like this in Springfield IL now. The science center or magic house in St Louis used to be the closest. There are many awesome interactive attractions and what a great way to learn through play!

An absolute blast for all of us (1, 23, 25, & 51). While I was limited due to a broken ankle/cast and my daughter wasn't able to comprehend the learning that it's set up for, we had non stop giggles and screams of enjoyment from her (and us). We can't wait to go back when she's older and more active in engagement with the set ups!
Well designed and engaging children's museum! Fun for a wide age range. The kids learned new things and had a great time pretending and playing. Definitely worth the visit!

What a great place to take the kids. We went for a birthday party.  Great staff and exhibits.  Nice rooms for the party to meet and open gifts and eat cake. Highly recommend this for all ages of kids.

Excellent place to visit with your kids. The 3 levels are designed with different types of play areas for different age groups. The first level is for very small children with water activity and fruits, vegetables, meats, etc. The next 2 levels are for next age group with advanced games and science activity like understanding the energy and things like that.

name: Cozy Dog Drive In
address: 2935 S 6th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Cozy Dog is a must stop in Springfield. The older folks will love all the memorabilia inside. The prices are very cheap and the food is good every single time. Plan on sharing fries if there are two of you because there are plenty to go around!

Fantastic,  reminiscent of The Burger King back home. I have been coming to Springfield for 30+ years and this evening was my first time here.  I cannot believe it took me this long to stop in. Great burger n the batter on the cozy dog was light and airy and had surprisingly little grease. Well worth the stop.

If you're looking for corn dogs you can't get better than this place. The staff was nice and even let the kids poke their heads into the kitchen to see how the dogs are made. Food was fast and fresh. Obviously corn dogs were great, but extra points for the amazing french fries. Yum!!

This place was sub-par. Was looking for a quick hot dog joint when we stumbled upon this place. "The birthplace of the corn dog". Little did we know saying corn dog at this place was a horrible sin because in fact, no, they do not serve corn dogs, they serve Cozy Dogs. I'm sorry. I've never in my life heard of a Cozy Dog before that day, so I'm sorry that I just wanted to be sure of what I was ordering. They guy gave such attitude and wouldn't answer the dang question. "It's a cozy dog. It's a cozy dog." Turns out, a cozy dog is a soggy and sad excuse for a corn dog. Everything food wise about this place was a big old Meh. It only gets two stars cause the memorabilia was kinda neat.

Good food at a historic stop on Route 66. The cozy dogs were tasty. The breading was good and the dogs are great. Really loved having a chance to check this place out during our road trip. Lots of interesting history of Route 66 and a little gift shop too!

name: Henson Robinson Zoo
address: 1100 E Lake Shore Dr, Springfield, IL 62712, USA
reviews: I have enjoyed going to this zoo since I was a kid. Very friendly and helpful staff. Love all the events that they have every year and have since I was a child. Now I take my three girls of my own there and watch their eye's light up with excitement of seeing all the different species of animals that they have there. Have always recommended for people to definitely visit there if they have never been.

This is a great zoo! It's never too over packed! Our family enjoys not being in the bigger crowds. Although I wish the zoo got more attention, I know when we go there its never to chaotic to let my kids run ahead of me a little bit and not worry about them getting lost. 

They also have a play ground inside the zoo!

This was an amazing experience for my two year old granddaughter. After four hours, she still didn't want to leave. The exhibits were amazing, clean, plenty of water and food for the animals. The staff was so nice and told us the donkey is Jasper and one of the horses is named Liberty. My granddaughter made fast friends at the playground, which was fantastic. Thank you Henson Robinson Zoo for making the a very memorable event for my granddaughter!

We had a great trip to Henson Robinson Zoo! It was a relaxed enjoyable time, without the overwhelming crowds and longer drive. We are very fortunate to have such a clean, well run zoo so close to home. Please support these places. You won't regret it.
The zoo has been around for years and it's perfect for smaller children learning about animals

name: Long Nine Junction
address: 5 W Old State Capitol Plaza, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews:
My partner and I just spent 36 hours in Springfield, and Long Nine Junction had the best food we tried in town. 
BUT the French Dip was probably the best I’ve ever had. The bun was soft and a little sweet, and the jus was lightly spiced and a little thickened- almost like a gravy, but not. 
I chose the side salad; it was dressed lightly and perfectly with a slightly sweet dressing that was probably balsamic vinegar with a little honey. 
Friendly, attentive staff and located very conveniently to the old state building and Lincoln’s law office.

This is a a small place and as a result, you may have to wait a bit for your food. However it's not worth the wait. My wife had the Cuba with Mac and cheese and I had a Memphis pulled pork sandwich with vegetable beef soup. All were incredibly good. Love goes into making this food for sure. Definitely worth a visit.
Nice spot across from the Old State Capital. Unique sandwich & side choices, everything I had was pretty tasty and high quality. Not a bad price either.
Every item on the menu is incredible. House made bread and slow roasted meats. There's always a line for a reason - it's that good and more than worth the wait!

Hands down the best sandwich I've ever had, let alone a Cubano. The mac&cheese side was not far behind. 
Also very filling, especially for the price. 
Definitely coming back here on my next business trip.

name: St. Katharine Drexel Parish
address: 722 S 12th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: I've only been to Sacred Heart, but not St Patrick. The Latin Mass at Sacred Heart is reverent, and full of prayerful contemplation. When you enter Sacred Heart Church, you will be inspired by its sacred beauty.
If you want a traditional mass with a high level of reverence and respect that most churches have forgotten then this is the place for you. Also has a great Latin mass.
Love the way they do things here. And the very humble priests are amazing.
We have the best priests and parish and masses in town.

name: Dickson Mounds State Museum
address: 10956 N Dickson Mounds Rd, Lewistown, IL 61542, USA
reviews: Awesome displays and very detailed reading materials all over.

Great place to explore the history of the native Americans that lived on the Illinois River and the people of that time period. Beautiful place at the park on top the hill at the museum.  Over looking the river valley, beautiful place to have a wedding. They have a pevion u can rent with power.  Make a donation to the museum is the charge. My daughter had her wedding there.  It was amazing.
Artifact fair today!! GREAT displays!! Friendly folks willing and eager to share their knowledge.

Museum and grounds are a little dated having it's last remodel in 1994. It's still a very nice facility with nice picnic area and playground. It's such a nice place to take an afternoon trip. The grounds are absolutely beautiful in the fall!!

great history shown about the native Indians in the prairie state. glad they finally closed buried the remains and not made to the public. real people living in tents like the past days. very educational with nice exhibits. a must stop for travellers.

name: Orthopedic Center of Illinois: Ronald R. Romanelli, MD
address: 1301 S Koke Mill Rd, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews:
Dr. Romanelli is a wonderful doctor. I had knee replacement surgery on November 5th and I was up and walking right away. 
I attended rehab classes at The rehabilitation center at the Orthopedic Center. 
Kayla and Rachel were my primary therapists and they were wonderful.  I have finished my therapy sessions and my knee is doing wonderful. I highly recommend them.

Dr Romenelli replaced my knee and was attentive to my ongoing care. His dedication to his profession was demonstrated throughout my initial and last visit with him! He gave me my swagger back! Thank you Dr. Romenelli!😊

This was my first knee replacement. I am very pleased with my surgery. All aspects of the surgery were clearly explained and discussed. Questions were encouraged. I called several times with questions I hadn’t thought about during office visits. Each of my questions were answered that day by patient, professional people. The joint class at St John’s helped make me more aware of what would happen to me, and all the things I needed to know to be prepared. I was still a bit anxious, it was major surgery after all, but I was able to sleep well before the procedure. Events happened as expected, no surprises. I received excellent care at St John’s. Dr Romanelli talked with me before and after the surgery to tell me again what he planned to do in surgery, and after to describe what happened and tell me about the pain management, therapy and discharge expectations. I called a couple of times after surgery, and received answers and assistance as needed. I was very pleased with Dr Romanelli and all of the people associated with OGI. 
I am having my right knee replaced by OGI in February 2020.
First appt with Dr. Romanelli but very impressed with him!  He not only jumped on starting my treatment that day but already is thinking down the road several steps ahead in case things don't work.

The treatment I received from dr Romanelli and his staff could not have been better. The procedure to fully replace my right shoulder went beyond my expectations.  I would recommend dr Romanelli to anyone for anything that he does. I can’t express how satisfied I am. Leonard white

name: Children's Discovery Museum
address: 101 E Beaufort St, Normal, IL 61761, USA
reviews: I've been here quite a few times and my kids love it here.  I have a science degree and I love how they have a whole floor dedicated to renewable energy, agricultural science, and compressed air.  My son loves that floor while my daughter loves the music and art floor.  It's cheap to go to and I highly recommend bringing your kids here.

In comparison to other discovery museums, they really went bare minimum on there exhibits, I have a feeling the grant money went to other (pet) Uptown projects, instead of child development, and exploration. Would you feel comfortable letting your child climb in the discovery net? refer to the picture, notice the missing cable clamps, instead they tied the cables in knots and wrapped they in duct tape. TOP NOTCH MAINTENANCE

The BEST kids activity in town! We have been members for several years and still enjoy every visit. Three floors of fun for all ages, plus many classes and special activities throughout the year. Always very clean, friendly staff, and a fun gift shop.

Lots to do! Spent about 4 hours playing and exploring and could have easily stayed longer if we didn't have a time constraint. Clean facility and staff is really friendly too. Great children's museum!
Place is my kids favorite place to celebrate birthdays!!! They love the stage, lights dress up and  puppets!! Also love the water play area and avantis pizza area!! A must see for younger kids!

name: Miller Park Zoo
address: 1020 S Morris Ave, Bloomington, IL 61701, USA
reviews: Great way to spend a sunny day. Exhibits are accessible and seemingly tidy. My children are always excited to visit.
Very good family entertainment. Personnel are friendly and professional. Good selection of animals for a small zoo. Kids love it.

I want it said, my 4 stars instead of 5 comes solely because its a small zoo. It is a great experience for what it is. They have a wonderful old carousel in the middle for small children that need a break (get tickets before you enter). They hosted baby snow leopards at one time and have some really nice upclose views of their rain forest exhibit and a few giant tortoises. At one time the family pass would get you in free or discounted to other nearby zoos too. I do not know if that is still the case but it was a very nice perk.

I love this zoo. Every time you go is a good time! It's a small zoo but it's ALWAYS fun and eventful. You can look on their website and find fun days. My daughter always loves getting her face painted.

Great zoo. The animals here are particularly cute and pretty fuzzy for the most part. There was an owl that looked at me funny every time we walked by him. Pretty suspicious, actually. Consider getting panda.

name: Peoria Riverfront Museum
address: 222 SW Washington St, Peoria, IL 61602, USA
reviews:
I felt that this museum lacked a lot.  A lot of the exhibits were closed which was frustrating. I kept thinking there was more to see, but there wasn’t.  We left after an hour and a half.  For $64 for a family or 4, I would have rather went to Chicago. 

The positive?  The building is very cool and the outside sculptures are really good.  And the staff is really nice.

It was decent. A lot of things need repairs and upgraded. Science stuff kind of neat. Kids enjoyed the museum some pretty cool history for Peoria Illinois. Worth a visit if you need something for the kids to do. Especially cool for people near or from the area and travelers alike. It takes about 2 hours minimum for a good visit.
We went on the free day and it didn't last too long for us. We got to explore a bit and from what we saw it was awesome. We can't wait to go back when it's a bit calmer so we can see more

A very nice educational trip for the kids and grownups. Staff has always been polite and very helpful. Pay attention to what exhibits and movies are playing, you may miss something you would enjoy. I recommend becoming a member if you are able. There are some nice perks to grab from time to time by doing so.

Only recently went, wish I had checked it out sooner. We went to both the moon and Leonardo DaVinci exhibits, both were very cool. Easily spent an hour at each one reading all the signs and little things. Parking is easy, and exhibits so far have been worth the price of admission. Music shows in the dome are a good time as well, loud with neat displays. My eye will be on what comes through next.

name: Caterpillar Visitors Center
address: 110 SW Washington St, Peoria, IL 61602, USA
reviews: Was a very fun and informative place. Tractors ect that kids could climb on and play on. They have simulators that was pretty cool for the adults and kids alike. Good place to visit with kids or as an adult. Retired Cat employees on the floor to answer questions. I would recommend checking it out.

It's a neat place; however, when the sole recognizable purpose of the venue is the glorification of Caterpillar you would expect the entrance fee to be a little less steep.

Cat employees get a discount, and the employee gets in free. A fair expectation for the amount of money Caterpillar pumped into the Foundation.

What you wouldn't expect is offering little or no discount to a school group visiting for educational purposes (and the number of parents who work at Caterpillar). Considering this is owned by a not for profit foundation, it makes no sense why they wouldn't reach out a little more vigorously.

Overall, when the Visitors Center was new, I could state it had some "state of the art" technology displays. As the place ages, and technology progresses, I would expect more frequent updates to the technology exhibits or a lower entry price.
Such a fun place for the family and kids. Very clean. So much to do and learn. This is  a must for anyone passing through Peoria

While there more for fun than education, I was introduced to the history of the CAT company. The initial movie is more of a sales pitch than a history lesson however, the fact that an entire theater fits in the bed of the largest vehicle made by them is fantastic.

As you move about the museum, you find touchstones of the past and the company vision for their future. 

I would definitely recommend visiting this place.

Very reasonable admission price, you go in and watch a short video, then go downstairs to an equipment floor.  You can climb up to the cab/control area of the machines.  There are simulators for kids for all ages.  There should be plenty of fun for kids.  Then there are exhibits about manufacturing and the history of the company.  It took about 1.5 hours to see it all.

name: Cahokia Mounds State Historic Site
address: Collinsville, IL, USA
reviews: We love visiting Cahokia mounds! The kids really enjoy the exhibits and the grounds are perfect for a relaxing walk outside. Climbing Monks Mound is especially fun for the little ones who enjoyed climbing up and down all of those stairs. We'll be back.

So, I love history! If you don’t, you may not see this as a worthwhile place to visit. I get into it, though.

This is an ancient mound site of the Cahokia People. There are signs around and paths for you to follow that explain what everything is. 

While walking around this entire area I could picture in my mind’s eye what it may have looked like anciently...the homes, indigenous people walking around. 

From the top of the main mound you can easily see St. Louis although it looks a good distance away. I counted the steps to the top of the mound when I visited, but danged if I can’t remember how many there are now. Total shot in the dark, but I want to say around 188-ish...

Great views from the top of the big mound.
This is probably one of the absolute coolest museums I've ever been to. Very well done, incredibly knowledgeable staff, amazing history and artifacts. Will definitely be back

On our way home from St Louis we stopped at the park. A part of North American history everyone should be aware of. Visitor center is modern with nice short film. Walking trails aroun the mounds are easy. Lots of steps on the largest mound. Park easy access from the Interstate.

We had a quick and fun stop here. 
We went to the large mound with the staircase. Not recommended for those who can't handle a great deal of stairs. For those who can, the view is great. 
Parking was crowded as it was a saturday afternoon, so be patient in the lot. 
There was an interpretive center across the street that had information for a suggest donation.

name: Edwardsville Children's Museum
address: 722 Holyoake Rd, Edwardsville, IL 62025, USA
reviews: This was our first time here and this trip was for ryah’s 5th birthday from her granny a day of fun. We really loved this place it is perfect for kids who love pretend play and my daughter loves this type of thing and we will most definitely be back here. She did not want to leave here lol
My family always has a great time here. Birthday parties, play dates, or just a day to get out of the house. It's fun to learn and use your imagination here.

Love this place! Super convenient and fun place to go for the little one to burn off some energy... especially on a rainy or cold day. I could see how older kids might get bored, but it's perfect for 1 year to maybe 6 or 7. Maybe not as amazing as the magic house, but it's close, relatively inexpensive, and way less crowded.
Small but mighty! Well kept and captivating activity centers for my 4 year old grandson. Thanks to the wonderful sponsors for the support of this community gem!
Kids (3 and 6) had a great time. Lots of stimulation and fun. Maybe not a perfect fit for 8+ but awesome for younger ones.

name: Drury Inn & Suites Springfield, IL
address: 3180 S Dirksen Pkwy, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: 1st time staying at a Drury Inn. Very impressive. Was greeted with a super friendly staff. Sam the shift manager was super nice and remembered my name the next day. Our room was in perfect condition. Bed was great. Bathroom was like brand new. I will definitely seek out this brand next time we travel.

Love staying at Drury Inn & Suites very clean rooms well decorated but more importantly the personnel was over the top professional & friendly.  Even the pool towels were replenished prior being completely depleted late in the evening. Can't say enough good things about the hospitality, happy hour everything!!! No competition for receiving the most Bang for your buck.
Great rooms. Great price. Loved the afternoon reception. Staff members really friendly.

We stayed here for just a couple of nights, but my 5 year old ended up getting a stomach bug on the first night. We had to call down late at night to get a change of sheets. The staff quickly came up and replaced the sheets and were extremely friendly and understanding. The next morning I went down to the front desk for something and again, they were extremely friendly. They asked about my daughter and made sure she was okay. They offered to get her whatever she needed even if the breakfast was no longer out. They offered to come clean the room or whatever we needed. When housekeeping came to change the sheets and replace the towels, I was still in the room with my daughter because she was still sick and I didn't want to contaminate the rest of the hotel. The lady offered to run across the street to get my daughter peidalyte and I have never been so taken aback by someone's offer. I politely declined, but this hotel staff has gone above and beyond my expectations. The entire stay so far has been wonderful, the hotel is clean, the pool and hot tub are nice, breakfast was good, but mainly this staff is outstanding. I will absolutely be coming back here!

All drurys are the same. Which isn't bad.  The staff will always bend over backwards to help you with any problem you may have. I do hope however that the corporation is paying these people a wage that can provide them a comfortable life. Hospitality starts at home and I hope the Drury corporation is hospitable enough to take care of their most valuable asset... their staff. For through them gems blossom.

name: Peoria Zoo
address: 2320 N Prospect Rd, Peoria, IL 61603, USA
reviews: The Peoria Zoo is a great place to take the kids on a day off of school. There are so many animals to see and the animals are really well taken care of. This is a place of enjoyment and you can see it all around you. I would definitely come here again and even bring my family to see

We had a good time. Zoo was well maintained and had a great assortment of animals. Was a pretty cool day so all the animals where out and about. Layout wasnt too bad, flowed all in one direction so you could see everything. Had nice play areas for the kids also when they got antsy and needed to run some. All the employees where nice and courteous. I would recommend checking it out.

Just right for grandparents to take grandchildren. Not so large that you can't see everything in a few hours. You can bring your own drinks and lunch. Plenty of places to quick picnic. For young families I would suggest bringing your own food and drinks as the prices are a little steep in the restaurant.  The souvenir shop has a large selection from which you can find more reasonably priced items to remember your visit.
This place has a park.childrens museum.botanical garden.and a lagoon. Wow!! Its very vintage everything neefd updating. But it has charm and craftsmanship.
Nice small zoo, free parking. Close to the children's play house.

name: Natures Select of Springfield
address: 540 W Monroe St, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Great selection of healthy fish. Such a cute little store. Staff is very friendly,  helpful, and knowledgeable. Prices are very competitive! Cheaper that online! Well worth the 2 hour drive!

Very helpful staff, if you need anything they don't have in-store to offer, you can ask and they'll contact their suppliers and find all nearby available options, as well as taking budget and distance into consideration.  Friendly and open to conversation, a nice spot to visit after school/work.  Say hello to their cats and ferrets, who they'll let you handle/pet!
Always helpful... They sell Ferrets and they are great... Playful not mean... Love the homey family feel... They seem to really care...
Awesome staff, answered lots of questions and even helped me me find products to specific measurements for a new tank.

Every time I visit the selction is pretty stellar. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the fish they have and what it takes to properly provide a good home for them. Also, the prices are very fair and nothing really that would make anyone do a double take. One of my personal favorite places to visit and get supplies.

name: Maldaner's Restaurant
address: 222 S 6th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: I ordered lunch and it was the best I ever had. I'd give them 10 stars if I could. The food was prepared perfect hot when I received it. I will he ordering again. Thank you for a fantastic luvh.

This restaurant was ok. When you initially enter it has a very high class feel. Then I was led to my table and discovered my seat was covered in duct tape. 

The Beef Wellington was very lack luster. The pastry was very soggy and the steak had little to no flavor. Come here for the simple lunch menu but avoid it if you want a Michelin Star dinner. 

If I was to creat a name for the style of this restaurant I was call it "trailer park millionaire".

Wonderful place and food. Superior atmosphere. A beautiful Italian Moscato with ribeye and wellington for dinner served by a very nice young man and super waiter named Bryant. Ask for him when you go. Happy Halloween everyone!

We may have arrived on an "off" night, however the service was less than desirable. To it's saving grace, the cocktails were an 8 out of 10 on a very rigorous scale. The portions were small, but delectable. That said, they were not in a rush to take our order or bring the food out. Take note in case you're glancing at the menu ahead of time: there *are* items ONLY offered at lunch, but not dinner. Desserts were well worth it.
I had a delicious Monte Cristo served with jalapeno jelly and homemade potato chips. The service was excellent! I also recommend the Queen of Sheba cake.

name: Gabatoni's Restaurant
address: 300 E Laurel St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Best Italian food in town! Their pizza is the best! My favorite thing though is the cheese tortellini with Alfredo sauce. I really like the atmosphere of the place as well, it just seems very cozy. The staff is very friendly and do their jobs well.

Very cool vibe! Loved all the different areas of the restaurant that each had their own charm. Construction and traffic in the area makes you have to really want to go there. The valet was a nightmare (particularly picking up). Chicken sandwich was good. Highly Recommended

One of my favorite places to visit in Springfield. It is so well maintained and the waiters are so friendly. The food is great for the price and tastes amazing. I have been there a couples of times and love the garlic bread, pizza, etc.

It was our first time at Gabatoni's...it seemed surprisingly busy for a Thursday night. Despite not having reservations, they were able to accommodate us. The staff was very friendly and if you like a thin crust pie, which I do, you'll love the pizza.
