I love Gabatoni's. The food is pretty good, and the atmosphere is unchanged from when I was a kid. It's truly one of the best examples around of an old Springfield family restaurant. It's a great place for a casual night out.

name: Cafe Moxo
address: 411 E Adams St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Very good lunch today at Cafe Moxo.  I had soup and half a sandwich.  The interior decorations were nice and the staff very friendly.   There was a wide selection on the menu of unique items.  I would definitely go there again.  The restaurant is very convenient to downtown Springfield and easy to get to.

This is a small business to be sure and support during the Stay-at-Home order. Our favorite thing to order is a late breakfast; the sandwiches are always hot, fruit cups and bakery items are fresh. Everything carries nicely from the restaurant to our house.

Very clean and nice place.  The food was good Minus the macaroni and cheese.  Just bland, no flavor and no cheese. Great location. 
The ordering staff was rude. I tried to ask a question and she was super rude. It was my first time there and I just had one small question. It wasnt even super busy at the time. So a little patience would have gone a long ways. On a positive note...their snickerdoodles....YUMMY!!!

Edit: For full disclosure purposes, I'm keeping the original up. I did not take their offer to make things right. Last time I ordered barbecue, but got buffalo. I may not have said it clearly at the time.

 This time I did an online order. Not only was my order correct this time, my food was ready way before the "order ready by" time. Ordering and pickup was simple. The staff were very friendly. I highly recommend Cafe Moxo

Original Review: Great place with fair prices. They lost one star for messing up my order, but even though I normally dislike what they gave me, I still enjoyed it. I'll definitely be going back soon.

Always a treat to go to Café Moxo, whether for a big lunch or just for a cup of coffee.  Great food, welcoming environment, very clean, and very friendly staff and management.  Shout out to Brandon... always on top of things and always has a big, sincere smile.

name: Indigo Restaurant
address: 3013 Lindbergh Blvd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: My husband and I went to Indigo last night to celebrate Valentines day.  The service and food was excellent.  Everything was brought out one at a time so we werent bombarded with a ton of food all at once.  We even got a complimentary hummus plate which maybe they offer to guests anyways but it was a nice surprise.  Our server helped us make our night special by taking good care of us and knowing when to just let us enjoy each others company.  We spent a lot but we planned on doing so instead of getting each other gifts so we went all out.  Did not disappoint.  Great job Indigo!
The staff was very helpful. We love to bring our business clients here.   Repeat customer... Will be back again and again
EZ was a great waiter and host.  I thoroughly enjoyed the environment and the food was superb! The only problem is that they're not open for lunch.  Definitely a great dinner spot.

Great server, Lindsay. The duck enchiladas were amazing, the stone appetizer was phenomenal, the tuna main course was perfect! Lobster bisque was wonderful.  Absolutely no negative remarks are necessary!!!!

Indigo was excellent. The atmosphere is cozy and I enjoyed the dim lighting. Our waitress was very attentive and gave lots of information about the menu. Lots of wine and appetizer options, which was impressive. The cheese plate we ordered was good and our salads came with a hummus plate with olives that was delicious. My boyfriend was extremely impressed with the flavor of his filet. I ordered the king crab legs and they were good, just not as flavorful as the snow crab I would normally order elsewhere. The restaurant was a bit pricy but, overall, I enjoyed my experience and will return with friends next time.

name: American Harvest Eatery
address: 3241 W Iles Ave, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews:
This is a first-rate restaurant in an unexpected location. The creative food prepared here is on par with any restaurant in a world-capitol city, not a State one... Tried to eat everything, but the extensive menu makes that impossible. Everything was crafted with care and the service from Kimberly was attentive but unobtrusive. 

This restaurant receives my highest recommendation if you are in Springfield!

This is my favorite restaurant around Springfield. The food is absolutely amazing. Sometimes the descriptions of the food sound like really odd combos, but they always work so well. It is on the pricey side, but it's absolutely worth it. They even have interesting and delicious cocktails. My favorite has been The Dude Abides, which was their take on a white russian.

Great menu creativity, but I cannot bring myself to support an establishment that treats employees the way they do here. Lots of discrimination. I saw zero servers who were not Caucasian, but many minorities working in the back doing dishes and other prep. It’s 2020. Can we please get over this. Not okay and will not support them again.

Menu offers a lot of variety, everything I've eaten here has been pretty good. Expect long wait times for a table, and consider sitting a the bar. Probably one of the best restaurants in Springfield in terms of menu offerings, food quality, and service.

Every detail is extraordinary! The ruby trout was delicious and well prepared, and the accompaniments were both diverse and harmonious. The pear pressure cocktail was a special for that night, and it was fantastic, but the 6 degrees of kevin bacon was a work if art! The candied bacon in the drink was soooo good!!! 
A fantastic find for the drive between Chicago and St. Louis!

name: Engrained Brewery & Restaurant
address: 1120 W, Lincolnshire Blvd, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: Definitely one of the best dining out experiences I've had in recent memory. Food was fantastic & local with a wide variety of choices. Beers were the same. Cheese curds were even better than Mar's Cheese Castle. Kids were happy. Ian our server was friendly & helpful. Can't ask for much more!

Kayla our server was terrific. We each ordered a paddle of beers.  She was very knowledgeable.  Started with cheese curds that were pillow soft and so flavorful.  The spicy dipping sauce worked with the cheese beautifully.  We shared a harvest salad.  It was delicious. Pecans, blue cheese crumbles, fresh greens a maple vinaigrette that I wasn't sure about but it was really good.   Hubby had the fish and chips I had the ruben, both with these great natural French fries.  Fish was perfect sandwich was awesome.  Next time we're in Springfield we'll definitely go back.

Absolutely love coming here when I'm visiting Springfield! Last time we came through they had a  tasty Blood Orange IPA on draft that was delicious and paired nicely with the featured Poutine Burger. Ian made our visit a memorable one and he had some great recommendations as we loved the loaded potato cakes! He was also very knowledgeable on all the food sources and beer making process and it was really cool to learn about! Can't wait to come back for a horseshoe soon.
Always on the lookout for a good reuben. They make their own corned beef and dressing, have fairly fresh crout, and marbled rye. Was delicious! Good, but not great, beer.

Kayla was absolutely the best!   Very attentive and yet not intrusive!    She knew the menu very well and answered all of our questions!   The Mikes Hot Ham was phenomenal.    Great food and great service made for a very enjoyable meal!

name: Loukinens' On Fourth
address: 517 S 4th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: My fiance took us here for our Valentine's Day dinner and we had a fantastic time. The food was delicious and I would highly recommend the jumbo  sea scallops. The best aspect of this restaurant, hands down, is the service. From the time we entered Loukinens' we felt welcomed. Our waiter was exceptional and gave great recommendations. Will definitely return in the future!
Great food and service! The atmosphere is also quite pleasant. This is a fine dining establishment and the prices reflect that, but in my opinion it is worth it. I will definitely be back.

The place looks nice and the food is delicious. I went there with my family and everyone enjoyed the food. We had an amazing time. The service was great, they made is feel special and fancy. I will definitely recommend it for another family or a couple.

Uhhhh... Amazing. I could start with how the simplest offering; the bread (House made) paired with whipped butter playfully infused with strawberry and tarragon is simply amazing! 

The Manchurian Cauliflower: Amazing
French Onion Soup: Perfect
Salmon: Flawless

The service was excellent, as was the ambiance. I'll be back whenever I'm in town!

Our office just had our Christmas lunch at Loukinens' on Fourth and everyone was wowed!  The comments I received back were: outstanding food; above and beyond service; best restaurant we have ever gone to for our Christmas lunch; on and on!  One of our staff had their 2 year old with her and they brought out toys for him to play with and helped entertain him.  Definitely on our list of go-back-to restaurants.

name: Augie's Front Burner
address: 109 S 5th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: During a weekend visit to Springfield, someone we met on the street recommended Augie's. We four had a SUPERB meal while snow blew furiously outside. One in our party has several diet restrictions--no problem: a wonderful, piping hot dinner appeared, made to order. Our lovely server was gracious and attentive.
This place is always delicious and an extraordinary value! Don't miss it! Just had the shrimp and grits! Tasty!
The Thursday three course option was excellent. The food was original and stupendous.

Lovely place for any meal. All of the food was very fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated. Highly recommend the lobster bisque. The waiter was friendly and attentive. Our food was out in well under 10 minutes, which is a miracle considering the high quality of the dishes. This place will definitely be a stop the next time I'm in Springfield!
Usually go for the Elk Burger, which is a seasonal item not currently available. No worries, there menu is loaded with lots more options. Can't go wrong at Augie's

name: Cooper's Hawk Winery & Restaurant
address: 2501 Wabash Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: What an amazing restaurant,  I can say I was fully satisfied and our waitress was amazing! The appetizer portions were worth it.  Happy Hour is from 3-6pm with great prices.  The Lux wine flight was fabulous. We visited at 5:30pm and it wasn't to busy.

The food was amazing. The service was amazing from the moment we walked in the door. The cheesy bread beyond addicting and the cocktails are out of this world. This place seriously is one of the tastiest places I have ever been to. Their salad bar was so yummy and had a great kale Cesar salad. We had such an awesome experience celebrating a birthday, we will definitely be back.
We had reservations and were immediately seated. Our server, Brandi was very helpful, friendly and attentive. The food was absolutely delicious. The wine selections we had were very good.

Love the Gnocci with Roasted Butternut Squash! Server was very nice and friendly I just wish they came around more often and it didn't take 20 minutes to get the check. So if you're not in a hurry and looking for a nice place to eat and be social this should be great.

short rib grilled cheese... good moist meat. Completely melted cheese blend and toasted to perfection.  Very solid sandwich, comes with tomato soup for that nostalgic dipping plus a side of fries.  Give it an 8 out of 10. 
Soy ginger salmon with wasabi mashed potatoes... the mashed potatoes were delicious although no hint of wasabi flavor.  The Asian slaw boasts cilantro, which I didn’t taste or see, but still super yummy and full of shaved veggies, salmon was on point, moist and cooked perfectly 7 out of 10 on this dish
Grapefruit martinis did not disappoint, plus we got a free sample of some their very own home made wines.  Over all very impressed with the atmosphere, service and food.  Ask for Anthony, he was one of the best servers we’ve ever had-start to finish!

name: VELE
address: 524 E Monroe St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: We sat at the bar and the servers were incredible and attentive. I was craving for spaghetti but had mistakenly gotten a very spicy seafood spaghetti sans seafood. It wasn’t edible so I got pasta with marinara. It was ok. It doesn’t come with anything else so I had a bowl of pasta. Hubby had the seafood spaghetti. Bill was $100. Not worth it but the atmosphere was nice.

Octopus appetizer was to die for. The fresh squid ink pasta w seafood was okay. The pasta itself w sauce was good but I was expecting chunks of seafood not just a few over cooked scallops. It was the end of the night so maybe they were out of seafood but in which case they should've told me. The service was Sooo slow and they only had four tables going... After they told me the kitchen was about to close and I better hurry I waited 15 min to take my order. anther waiter finally came to help me. I wish he stuck as my waiter because I kept waiting for the girl assigned to come back she was super friendly but really not aware. Throughout the night instead of coming to me she would just chit chat off to the side. I'm def coming back for the octopus...that's what's bringing me back. and I'll try something else. My drink sea and smoke..okay...presentation was cool but I guess you don't go to Italian restaurants for the cocktails. I was going to give it a three but I know it has potential and the octopus was awesome and pasta (minus seafood) very good plus cute space and ill give it another shot.

Bravo! Everything about the whole dining experience was excellent - the very friendly and warm welcome, sophisticated service and the main event - the food! Oh the food! Absolutely divine. We were limited on time so we just had shared appetizers but what we had was enough to know that we WILL be returning to experience more Vele! Thank you for a wonderful dining experience.
We had a wonderful extended dining experience. From the hostess, to the service, cocktails Wine and Food, we really enjoyed ourselves.
Wow! The vegan tofu dish I had was amazing. It was served over a bed of rice and greens, gluten free as well. Everything we ate and drank was delicious. I can't wait to eat here again

name: Nick & Nino's Penthouse Steakhouse
address: 700 E Adams St fl 30, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Service was excellent. Our waitress was amazing. Super nice, boxed up everything for us when we were done and took our picture for date night. The food was excellent. The bread basket is on point and offers a diverse group of different breads to try out. The lobster bisque was really tasty. Altho I am a fan of a little spice in my food, which is what made the bisque have a unique good flavor. The steak was cooked perfectly, it did have a bit much fat on it for my liking but that definitely didn't take away from the excellent flavor and the perfect medium rare cooking of it. We also ordered the hash brown brick. Definitely worth trying. Seasoned really well. Does need ketchup, not because of flavor but because it is dry, in my opinion. Dessert was phenomenal. We chose the Apple cheesecake and 9 layer chocolate cake. They have so many options available. There drink menu is worth sticking around for. They make delicious beverages. I ordered a spicy margarita drink and a filthy Manhattan. All of the flavors of each drink blended just perfectly. We didn't have a single bad thing there. Absolutely look forward to going back. The atmosphere is welcoming and the view over the city is pretty cool, since it is located on the 30th floor. The bar on the other side "Pinnacle lounge" I believe is what it's called, is bad. Don't go there. They do not know how to mix a drink properly. The amaretto sour I ordered tasted like weak Dollar general off brand koolaide mixed with pool water. Luckily tho that bar doesn't have anything to do with Nick and Nino's. Def go check out Nick and Nino's for great food, great service, and a romantic atmosphere.

Rick was the kindest, most attentive server I have ever had! He knew every detail about everything on the menu. Complements to the chef because everything was cooked perfectly. It was a joy to be served by Rick and enjoy a perfect evening with delicious food.
Best steak and service in Town

The service and food are excellent, and the atmosphere is unmatched in Springfield.  I would recommend N&N’s for a romantic date night; HOWEVER, be weary of the markup on wines. We were charged $44 for a $10 bottle of moscato (La Perlina).  I understand there’s an up charge for wines in restaurants, but 4.5x the retail price seems a little greedy to me...

Very cozy romantic place to have dinner while looking out over the city. I had the firecracker and grilled shrimp aside my pork steak and my date had the rack of lamb. Everything was delicious and she was pleased too. The waiter was very nice as well.

name: Little Saigon Restaurant
address: 1531 Wabash Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Wait staff is always very friendly and upbeat! Occasionally you may have to ask them to repeat what they said if you aren't accustomed to their spoken language, but they are always willing to clarify. The food is consistently delicious and arrives to the table very quickly. Great for date night!
Restaurant gives good vibes. I strongly recommend either filtered hot coffee or avocado smoothie. Vegetable Soup was amazing. Curry fried rice and eggplant dish was delicious.

I was visiting Springfield and this little gem was close to my hotel and decided to try it after seeing the reviews. The restaurant is easy to find and there's ample parking available onsite. The place was extremely clean and I even witnessed one of the waitresses inspecting every table to make sure it was 100% clean. The attentiveness of the staff was also very respectful and friendly. As for the food I ordered their pad Thai and it was amazingly delicious. The noodles had a distinct taste of garlic and other Asian flavors that wanted you to have more of it. Definitely recommend this place for a nice quiet dinner.
Take out orders are always ready when I arrive. One of my favorite places. Great tasting food. Especially like the satay chicken appetizer. I often order it as a meal.

Authentic pho here with fresh vegetables, basil, jalapeno, etc. Their taro freeze was amazing as well. Hot and sour soup was spicy and full of fresh vegetables. The tripe in the Saigon pho was cooked to perfection and was delicious. Our server Emma was very attentive, happy, and a pleasure to have wait on us. It's worth going out of your way for this place!

name: Mariah's Restaurant
address: 3317 Robbins Rd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: The food was amazing as always. Had a small mix up With the order ,but they went above and beyond to make it right when it could have very easily been my fault.  Can’t say enough about the food and service.  We will be back very soon.

Beautiful and amazing restaurant, nicely decorated. Food is very delicious, very generous served portions at a reasonable price. John, our Server, was very attentive and polite. He made us feel at home. Highly recommend this beautiful Log Cabin Restaurant (Italian Steakhouse).

We pre-ordered and paid for Easter dinner. It was to be ready to pick up at noon. I got there at 11:55 am and waited in line until 1:30 pm for food. The food seemed cold and and I asked if it had been setting around long. I was told that I was lucky that I got food at all since it is a pandemic. I also heard the person handing out the food tell another customer that it was not his problem that their order was wrong and take what they could get.  When I got home checked the food, the 4 gravy containers were punctured in the top like some one put their finger through it. There was gravy everywhere. The prime rib was very tough and over done  I think that for $140, it would have been a better experience. 
No one should patronize them any more.

My wife and I went here to celebrate valentine's day early. The food was fantastic! The bone in ribeye was cooked to a perfect medium, and the calamari we had as an appetizer was by far the best I've had outside of a coastal city. My wife was singing the praises of her filet for two days. Our server Carie provided us with expert service that was both attentive and friendly. This was truly the best dining experience either my wife or I has ever had. Thank you for making our date perfect.

I like to call this place one of Springfield's bed kept secrets. AmaZing food, great service, and the steaks cannot be beat. The ambiance is fantastic and their are two fireplaces to keep you cozy. They have U SDA prime steaks. One of my favorite places to eat.

name: Lake Pointe Grill
address: 1386 Toronto Rd, Springfield, IL 62712, USA
reviews: Corned Beef, cabbage and potatoes from Lake Pointe Grill are so good. Food was delivered so quick and was still piping hot! Thank you Lake Pointe for saving our 8th wedding anniversary!

The food was delicious! The chips and dip were so good.  The salsa was the best I ever had.  My husband had the stuffed meatloaf with real mashed  potatoes and green beans. He really liked it.  I had the Michigan Ave. Pizza.  So good!  Eric the bartender was our server.  He made the experience  so fun and made the best martini.  I would recommend this place!

Loved the food, the variety on the menu (including vegetarian options), and most of all, the amazing service! So friendly, helpful, and quick! All of our food was delicious. We will definitely come back if we're in the area again.
The new menu is great.  We appreciate the great hospitality of your staff and the family friendly atmosphere.  Be sure to give this great restaurant a try.  You WILL NOT be disappointed.
It was delicious. service was good. atmosphere is great.

name: Saputo's
address: 801 E Monroe St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Good Italian. Good service, nice atmosphere. My only complaint is that everything pasta wise has pork- the ravioli, the meatballs, meat sauce, etc. Nothing is only beef. Only way to avoid it is to get the cheese versions and/or order marinara.
Awesome home style italian. Chicken parmigiana was the best. Red sauce is to die for. Service is great. Nothing bad to say.

Saputo's has recently become a new favorite of mine. Their salad dressing is superb. Their stuffed manicotti with meatballs is my absolute favorite. The service is always great and the food is hot and tasty. Alfredo is delicious also and definitely homemade. I have not had a restaurant that I have ever craved like I crave Saputo's. Love that place. Hope I can eat there again soon!

The service was excellent. The food was good but did not justify the high price. The marinara sauce was tasty but is rather spicy, which was unexpected and not enjoyable. The linguine with white clam sauce was watery. Not a sauce more like a broth. They packaged our leftovers in leakable containers. When we got home and lifted the bag out of the car the bottom was soaking wet, broke through and the food ended up in my car and on the driveway. Again it was not a bad meal but certainly did not justify the prices.

Dinner was delicious and beautifully served. The table and decorations were love as was the ladies room.  Thank you so much for getting us in an hour before our expected time.
Also about a month ago we came and picked up take out for our daughter and grandchildren who were returning to Chicago on the train.  That meal was perfect and deliciously hot when they got to eat it around Lincoln.

name: Westwoods Lodge Pub & Grill
address: 2406 W Jefferson St, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Westwood's is a great place. It has a good selection of craft beer, unique foods, and a good atmosphere.

Enjoyed the Friday night fish.  Even though not real walleye, the fish was very tasty along with the sides.  Mrs had catfish and she really enjoyed her meal.  Posted picture of the real thing tho from real life experiences.
Great food and drinks with an outdoors theme. You can go with standard bar food, or try some of their nice dinners and custom gourmet burger recipes.
Great food love the decor great food creations.

good food service started out good drink order quick 
then down hill from there two came on after us then seven came in then drinks served to both groups server left came back took and delivered order for seven before  us she had to be reminded by other group of two we had been seated before them  neither of us had our orders taken yet

name: Texas Roadhouse
address: 2540 W Iles Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: We usually have a fairly large group when heading to Texas Roadhouse. It doesn't seem to cause any issues for them which is nice. They have many tables setup for large groups and are fast at turning them around. That being said, busy nights like Friday and Saturday you will still likely have a moderate wait. I believe they still offer call ahead to save a spot in the que which is nice. Kick back and enjoy y'all!

Texas roadhouse in general is a family favorite! However this one is a personal favorite! All of their staff is always kind and on top of it! Always feel welcome and well taken care of! Including pictures of their menu because I always love being able to look at that.

The ribs I had were excellent. Very tasty and and done s they should be. My wife's rib eye was a bit tough and not as done s she had ordered. The waiter was good but it took a long time to get an extra condiment.

This place has now been added to our favorite places for dinner! Server, Nicole, was very attentive without being a nuisance. Food was prepared to perfection. Festive atmosphere yet we could talk without screaming. Well worth the wait!

We had a party of 8 guys. They got us in fairly quickly, once seated we got drinks fast. Amanda our server admitted she was only in her first week. The group of guys gave her a hard time and she played right along! She was great! All around I would definitely recommend this place! 
Steaks were all cooked as ordered, food came out in order.

name: The Feed Store
address: 516 E Adams St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Who knew that a twenty foot wide store front across from the Old State Capital and within  walking distance from all important state offices, would have the depth to support a lunch time menu. But the line along the west wall and few, few empty wooden chairs tell the story. There still is a wait for  so plan accordingly and when delivered  to the table, you know why this is the cross road of tourist, visitor and government staff.

Stopped in for lunch on a recent Friday at 11:30am before the noon lunch crowd. The place had customers but was good timing on my part. I ordered at the counter; potato soup, half a sandwich-chicken salad on whole wheat bread. The soup was excellent good potato flavor, chicken salad was good but void of any real flavor. NOTE: you order at the counter and they bring your food to your table.
Great food sandwiches soups drinks. I worked there years ago, nice people to work for and with. But it's only part time. Had to leave for more hours. Just a great place to eat.
An hour and half for a sandwich and chips? And then the sandwich is practically meatless (pastrami was hardly there). POOR! A heads up would have been nice that the wait was going to be awhile. ☹️
Fast service, no frills, amazing sandwiches and soup. Their chicken salad is amazing, and comes highly recommended. Affordable and comfortable.

name: Flavor of India
address: 3124 Montvale Dr, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: We have been going there for nearly 8 years. The food is consistently delicious, very affordable and outstanding service. Words are not adequate to express how much I recommend this place. Go and check it out!
Not a lot of flavor from spices in their dishes on the lunch buffet, and the sauces were quite watery and not thick enough.  Not bad, per se, but not exactly good.  Seriously disappointed.

Food was fresh and delicious. We were served quickly with attentive service. Food is spiced from 0-6 on a scale. I am usually a medium spice person and a 3 was just about where I liked it, but am glad I didn’t go higher. Glad they kept my water refilled The Who time. Chicken tandoori was delicious.
Great Indian treats! Everything at lunch was exceptionally fresh and tasty, nicely spiced and hot! Will eat here again for sure, affordable and wonderful service.
Not as flavorful. First time and was a bit slow to take order. However I have been told this is better than gateway to India so choose wisely. Will visit again and update accordingly.

name: James' Home Kitchen
address: 2901 Chatham Rd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Incredible authentic fresh cooked food. Don’t be in a hurry but slow down. Have a drink and enjoy. Wonderful people too. You will not see a food truck making deliveries here. Everything fresh.

Food is very fresh and everything, yes we've had it all, is spectacular. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. You couldn't ask for better owners. It's very evident how much love they have for their business and their customers. The setting is very comfortable and casual, and the restaurant is immaculately clean (even the restrooms). This restaurant quickly became a family favorite.

Wonderful family own place! The owners are so nice and enjoy talking about the food they serve. Everything tasted treat from start to finish! We had pot stickers, wings, bulgogi beef, honey chicken and brisket...soooo good!!!
Very good food...but it was slightly strange eating Asian food in a log cabin while listening to josh groban music

I’ve been dining at James Home Kitchen for over two years and it has been excellent every time. It’s genuinely my favorite restaurant and I recommend it to everyone when discussing restaurants. James himself frequently checks on the tables to ensure everyone is satisfied. I’ve seen him sing happy birthday to customers and he’s personally brought me a free sample dish of popular Taiwanese food.

name: Alexander's Steakhouse
address: 620 Bruns Ln, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Staff has always been friendly. We usually do not get a reservation, however I would strongly suggest it. It was a very busy night when we went. As always the salad bar is by far one of the best things about the place. It is a simple bar but you can load your plate up with about anything you want on a salad. The dressings are all great also. The steaks are always perfect. We always cook them ourselves but their cooks do a fantastic job also. I will usually chat with them while cooking my steak. Will be back for another dinner.

Always friendly staff. Bar is secluded and off from restaurant. Great salad bar for meal. Cooks are great. Fun to cook your own! Great price and quantity as well as quality! Great specials. Never had a bad meal. Great selection!

Casual steakhouse, with tasty steaks! Meals come with a salad bar, baked potato, and Texas toast. It offers the unique opportunity to season and cook your own steak (meat), or let their chef do it for you. I loved the salad bar because I could doctor my potato with all the fixings. And their famous skillet cookie was amazing (as you can tell by the empty skillet)! Absolutely wonderful meal!
Best steaks by far. Nice atmosphere and hot waitresses. The men are kinda hot too!! Be sure and ask for Brooke, she's my favorite, although the entire staff is great!

Too pricey for the less than basic meal.  My husband felt we were at a resurrected Ponderosa.  Atmosphere was not up to speed, the tables and chairs were thrown in of no matching decor.  The most attractive site was the unused grill in the center of the restaurant.  The least attractive was the packaged loaves of basic bread that take out restaurants use.  My husband took me there to celebrate my birthday, I wish we were at our frequent visited seafood joint (Chesapeake).  Scratch the outdated salad bar, Update the settings and never offer swordfish are a few starters for an improvement project.  Match your prices with your products and services, customers deserve better.

name: Tacology 101
address: 219 S 5th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: The food was amazing. The flavors will make your tastebuds dance. I can't wait to go back. I tried the fish taco and it was lite and fresh. The sides were well cook too.

This place is a pleasant surprise. The food is delicious, large portions and I found the price to be very reasonable. Definitely recommend this place.
 The food is more authentic than you will find at most places. Keep this in mind if you prefer American Mexican food or haven't had authentic Mexican food.

This place is absolutely amazing! I'm from San Diego and these tacos and appetizers could compete with anyone who comes from the border! Their fries were as crispy and thick cut as could be, and their Nashville tacos were so spicy and delicious. I would give it a 7/10 on the spiciness scale and it's definitely something that hits you on the back end. I absolutely respect their owner who was out working with the rest of his workers. This is a wonderful taco place. Well worth the price!!!

Whom I believe is the owner or manger. Talked down to me as a customer. Was rude when I wanted to check and make sure my whole TOGO order was in the bag. Was rude when I asked his opinion And never told me there was a charge to have the order placed Togo. Word of mouth is more then any review. The food was good but not original Mexican food. Will not be back abs will be sure to review every website that it affects your business
Great tacos! Must eat in Springfield IL👍

name: Joseph's Fine Cuisine
address: 3153 Hedley Rd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Unique twist on food. Not strange but interesting and tasty!  If you want to eat somewhere that doesn’t taste the same as your typical chain restaurants, try this place! Ate here for the first time today. People ACTUALLY dressed up. Wished there were more veggies on the plates but what was there was yummy!  And the desserts?! Oh my!  So good!
Food is amazing! Looking forward to their 5 course meals they offer! Their chef and staff make this a place somewhere we want to keep coming back to.
The lobster bisque was some of the best I've ever had! Every single dish was perfect and the kitchen was so quick. The staff are wonderful and the service was top notch.

First visit was fine. Second lunch visit was Friday 12/6. The bartender & apparently only server were the same. She seated us with menus, no water, nothing. We could have been content for a bit if she had at least offered to get us some wine BUT 20 MINUTES LATER SHE NEVER RETURNED. NEITHER WILL WE! There are way too many dining choices now in Springfield to take a chance on this place. Too bad...it had possibilities, but don't waste your time and money. BB

Impressed with this newly opened restaurant. Good wine list, great appetizers, tapas, menu and even dessert! Staff was knowledgeable and friendly! Great bartender. Love the open kitchen! Unexpected surprise.

name: Mimosa
address: 4201 Wabash Ave, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: My wife and I stopped in for lunch because we were at a nearby business. The food and service were both excellent. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys this cuisine.

Food is amazing. I loved the avocado smoothie and curry fried rice. General TSO chicken is pretty good too. Ambience is very soothing. Although I would suggest to call in advance as the place always looks busy.
A decent Thai restaurant with a standard menu. Portion sizes are big, ambience is good but the service is slow. Would still go again and try out more menu options!
Decent place with peaceful ambience with good food
The entrees are great.  The sushi lunch special is a fantastic deal.  The service has always been great as well.

name: D'Arcy's Pint
address: 661 W Stanford Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews:
Very friendly service and very attentive service, I love it when I never see the bottom of my glass. I ordered something called a horseshoe and was very disappointed. I'm not sure of the idea and why it was created. Maybe, just trying to be different. I would rather have had and open-faced  beef sandwich with fries on the side.
Other than that was my mistake in ordering it because we are new to the area and like to try new dishes, this was one I could do without.
Now the restaurant itself was very nice for an Irish pub theme. Enjoyed myself immensely in it's atmosphere and among long time local patrons as well as the employees. I love to see just everyday local people that aren't these picture perfect servers. We're from out west and it seems that unless your tall and leggy and have a perfectly shaped backside, your not going to get hired as a server. Good decision on hiring just normal everyday folks with good attitudes and warm smiles. I will be back, just not for the horseshoe, by the way, my wife, loves the horseshoe.

I got the corned beef pony. The corned beef was thinner than I expected but it was fresh! I think if I get the pony again I would get the hamburger. There was too much cheese on the corned beef for my liking. I think the hamburger would be the perfect thickness for the amount of cheese they serve.

It's one of the most popular restaurants in town for good reason. The horseshoes are the best I have had (and I have tried a ton of them) and they are just consistently good. I have had the same order here for 17 years because of that. There is usually a wait to be seated when I come but the kitchen gets food out fast so they turn around tables pretty rapidly so you don't have to wait super long. If you like buffalo chicken definitely get the horseshoe of it with the spicy cheese sauce because it is the best thing on the menu.

Fast food time with 5 start quality dinner, and very friendly staff, please remember even if you pick up your order to tip the workers in these rough times they still get the same pay as if you went inside to eat. The kid who brought out my food almost cried i gave him a $5 tip as i was the only person who left a tip this week

I discovered this place on a road trip a few years ago and now it is my stop for lunch if I go by. I live in Michigan and would drive here monthly if I could. Their horse shoes and ponies are delightful. They are melt in your mouth comfort food. I recommend this place to anyone especially if your looking for the shoes. Line can be long, either wait or sit at the bar.

name: Charlie Parker's Diner
address: 700 W North St, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Tons of food. Buffalo shoe was amazing. So was the country fried steak breakfast shoe. Omelet was not my favorite. Great friendly service!

During an otherwise of town excursion with my family we stopped in at Charlie Parker's. It was near closing time, we had an hour and a half to dine. It was packed. The aroma as we entered was intoxicating. It smelled so delicious. We didn't have to wait long to be served at all. We had a restless toddler with us and the wait staff were fantastic at accommodating us. Patricia, our wait person, was amazing. We will be stopping in again when next we're in town.

It's a historic place to get a historically great breakfast. Giant pancakes? Great coffee? Friendly service? They got it. If you're unfamiliar with the edible shoe, we'll they have a nice selection of those also. It's a Midwestern thing. You won't leave hungry that's for sure. They also have a food challenge available but good luck with all that.

We just moved to Illinois,  decided to take a road trip to Springfield and visited charlie parkers diner. It was delicious! And the portions are so hearty. We all enjoyed it and will be going back again for sure!

Charlie Parker's Diner was amazingly FAST! And delicious! My breakfast was very good and came within just a few minutes of ordering. Eggs were perfectly cooked over-easy. My coffee cup was never empty. Families with little kids, grizzled guys in hats, a group of 6 ladies and everyone in between were all served by the fantastic waitresses with smiles all around. It really doesn't get better than this!

name: Kiku Japanese Steak and Seafood House
address: 3050 Lindbergh Blvd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: We went for supper at 5pm. It was nice to be seated right away and not have to wait to be served hibachi until others arrived.  Our waiter and hibachi cook were amazing.  The food was great. The cook was very entertaining and since we were by ourselves it was a little romantic.

The restaurant has pleasant atmosphere.  You can sit in dinning area or hibachi.  We sat in the dinning area.  The staff was immediately at our table to take drink orders.  We all choose the multi course meals which include soup, salad, and entree.  The food was well prepared.  I would suggest that they would be less aggressive around clearing plates.  I had to tell the wait person several times that I didn't want my plate taken as we were sharing food among the 3 of us.

Everything I got to try surpassed my expectations. I love sushi but Kiku set the bar pretty high. Very fresh tasting sushi. Volcano roll and shrimp tempura roll are definitely my favorites. Definitely coming back, would love to try the hibachi grill.

Had a wonderful time celebrating my birthday here.  The other people sharing the table were also celebrating a birthday. 
  Not only was it fun and entertaining but every part of the dinner was wonderfully cooked to perfection!  And they brought us a birthday treat!  I loved it!
Meal was good (miso soup was just okay). Menu is more American-Japanese than completely authentic. Service was excellent

name: Curate
address: 2930 Plaza Dr, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Mike and I had dinner here for the first time at the end of February. Wonderful dining experience!! Autumn was a delight!! If I could give 6 stars, I would! Great date night with my mate! We will be back!

We really loved this place. 1st time there since their opening. Love the way they have changed the look of the place. The food and service was just outstanding. The pasta in a parmesan cheese bowl is a must try. Will be back soon.

This is a small business to be sure and support during (and after!) the Stay-at-Home order. We love Curate, but I especially want to review how great their carry out dinner was last night. The menu has items from Curate and VELE, and if you haven’t tried it yet, I highly recommend. 

We typically do not like carry out from anywhere, so at first were a little suspect about how the food would be “to-go,” but the way they package the food actually carried extremely well from restaurant to house and it was all still hot. They put all of their sauces and garnishes in little containers on the side so nothing gets soggy or out of place (even the dishes that come on top of their awesome mashed potatoes!), and the fish and chips is something we probably would never order at the restaurant, but we got it to go last night and it was insanely good—still crispy and hot by the time we got home!

Absolutely AMAZING dinning experience!  The food was exceptional and the service was impeccable - warm and friendly!  Their menu was like nothing I've seen!  Small portions which enables patrons to sample several entrees in a single outing - a great concept!
Eclectic food, excellent service and a warm and inviting ambiance. Make sure to try the Truffle Cacio e Pepe and the Roasted Brie--absolutely delicious!!

name: Xochimilco Mexican Restaurant
address: 3210 Northfield Dr, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Just beat a large group tonight. Great waiter tool our drink order and brought some warm chips and salsa. Food order placed. Dinner served quickly and was hot and fresh tasting. Great job.

No question about the fact that Xoci is the BEST mexican restaurant in town! When you walk in either location you feel like family and everyone will always remember you. Amazing food and amazing service- Will always highly recommend
Warm tortilla chips and salsa upon being seated. Freshly cooked Mexican food. Gracious, attentive staff. Ample portions. Relaxed atmosphere. Tables, booths and bar seating.
Just got to go for pick up. Amazing job guys! Thank you!
It was really good. The servers were very friendly and pretty humorous.  The food came out very fast. The portions were large and very flavorful.

name: Old Luxemburg Inn
address: 1900 S 15th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Food was exceptional for a family or friends gathering although the seafood platter seemed to be more breading than seafood. Wait staff were kind and always had that cheer that you don't always recieve. All in all, I would say it is a hidden gem of Springfield.

This is one of those restaurants that has been in Springfield for ages. There is a reason it has lasted so long and is one of the city's favorite places to eat steak and lobster. The food and atmosphere are good, and I always enjoy my time at the Old Lux.
Food was delicious and very good size portions. Steak was juicy and tender. Good atmosphere and staff was friendly
Waitress was overwhelmed with too many tables.  Fried Chicken was a lot of breading and so crispy hard to bite in to.  Steaks looked good.  Tried my husband steak it was tasty.
This is a great place to get a steak dinner! Very friendly staff and the place has a cozy atmosphere. I was just a bit disappointed that they don’t have beer on tap.

name: Boccardi's Italian Imports
address: 3132 Cockrell Ln, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: Great food and service! Outdoor dinning, easy parking. My girlfriend from New York said it's the best Italian food in Springfield. I think they're all great, but she said it was authentic Italian.
Just ate there for the first time tonight, why oh why did I wait this long? Their meat sauce is one of the best I've had in town. Very friendly staff and of course Maria the owner is so nice.

Every time I have been here they exceed all expectations! Their food is amazing and the service is even better. They have a very well rounded staff that are extremely polite, attentive, and knowledgeable. Must go place for great authentic Italian cuisine!
Absolutely some of the best home cooked italian that I've had in years! Very friendly staff and atmosphere. The lemon marscipone I could kill someone over!!! So 5 stars all day. 6 if I could.
Authentic Italian Cuisine and superb customer service!!! Excellent staff!!!

name: Arlington's
address: 210 Broadway, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Great service! Brandon was wonderful. Weird, awesome decor. Fantastic, inventive food. I wonder how long it takes employees to get used to the mannequin in the hallway 😆

Excellent food, fast, professional service and in a relaxed atmosphere.  Our group descended on them like a horde of Vikings and I thought they would be overwhelmed.  But they handled the situation with style.  Friendly, people and for such a small staff, truly outstanding service.
Top  Mark's all the way around.

One of the the best places to have dinner downtown. The atmosphere of Arlington's is charming and whimsical. Guests arrive dressed in jeans and a ball cap all the way to suits and cocktail dresses. Local artists display their work on the walls. There is no other place like it that I have found in downtown Springfield.
Delicious local delicacy, the pony and horse shoe. Just do yourself a favor and get one.
Food and drinks were good.  Burger was cooked amazingly and rib eye sandwich wad soooooo tender. Really enjoyed the appetizers. They had life music which was nice and not too loud.

name: Mario's Italian Restaurant
address: 3073 E Clear Lake Ave, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: Went in for the lunch buffet that runs from 11-2.  For a whole $11 + tip it includes a great buffet (salads, antipasto, pasta, pizzas), drink, and tax.  The food is terrific, staff are very friendly people, and the joint is popular.  A great Springfield find!  Will certainly return!

My husband and I recently visited to this place and we both love this place. This is going to be our little gem. He got cheese ravioli with tomato Alfredo sauce with a side of Caesar salad. Ravioli was amazing even though we couldn't say the same for the salad. It wasn't terrible. But It was average Caesar salad. I got Italian sausage sandwich with a side of fries. First of all fries were spectacular! So crispy and fluffy. I love their sausage as well. Well spiced! Over all, I will most definitely return to this place to try other foods.

Always friendly. Food is always great. Excellent service and price. Always clean. Great bar. Comfortable seating. Awesome selection that they have NOT pigeoned just into pizza! A lot of their pasta dishes are amazing!
Great pizza and a Springfield staple. The lunch buffet is good as well. Friendly staff. The bathrooms are a bit small.
Seafood lasanga covered in a Portabella mushroom sauce. The sauce has a very rich flavor. Served with a Caesar salad. Great dinner

name: Osaka | Japanese Restaurant
address: 1665 Wabash Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: I have been to Osaka many times over the last year.  This experience was not as good as the previous visits.  We went with some co-workers for lunch.  I ordered the lunch special with two sushi rolls. One of the rolls was semi warm instead of the typical cold temperature.  The service was mediocre and someone in the kitchen shrieked loudly like there was something wrong. Overall it was alright but it seems like the restaurant is starting to get dated and there are patched marks on the walls. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in town.  The food is generally really good but for the price I think the restaurant could use some updating and maybe a fresh coat of paint.  I realize the aesthetics are not everything but I feel like it is all part of going to a nicer restaurant.

Glen B. @ the Sushi bar is the ONLY reason we gave 5 stars! His ability to carry a conversation,awesome personality & his amazing IMAGINATION with making the most tastiest rolls!!  I'm glad we stopped in, Thanks Glen!!!!

We had a birthday here, and the service is the best I've had from a restaurant. Not only were all of the waiters and cooks friendly, their professionalism with how they did everything from helping me order vegan at the hibachi grill to how they came out with the cupcakes we brought with a sparkling candle all impressed me. I'd definitely recommend Osaka to anyone interested in some of the best Japanese food and service in the area.

The food is outstanding!! From start to finish the presentation and flavor are to die for. Great drinks and atmosphere as well as family friendly. We had the best waitress in the entire place! Daphne is absolutely amazing and I will always make sure to request one of her tables, I suggest you do the same!!
Very fun place great place for group of friends you sit at the same table and watch their chef cook right in front of them. Plenty of food food the steak I had was very good with lots to take home

name: Springfield Char House
address: 2500 Sunrise Dr, Springfield, IL 62723, USA
reviews: There were four of us for dinner. and our server and the food were both excellent. I had the rib-eye, and it was cooked perfectly medium rare. My wife had several vegetable dishes. the others in our party had chicken tender and chopped  steak. The portions were large, and they both took some home. We've been here several times, and it's always been good.

We were up in Springfield for a getaway weekend and Springfield Char House was recommended highly.  Being near the hotel we were staying at, we decided to give this restaurant a try.

It was an early Saturday evening and the restaurant was not very busy; however, we were pointedly seated and left with menus.  The menu, rather the selection of menu items, was probably the best part of our experience.  After a few minutes, our server emerged to ask for our beverage selection and to see if we were ready to select our entrees.  Instead, we requested an appetizer with our drinks.

A short time later, our server brought our drinks and took our order.  I chose the Fettuccini Alfredo with Chicken Breast, and my wife chose the Tuscan Chicken.  A few minutes later, she returned with our salads.  A few minutes into our salads, our server returned with our entrees as well as our appetizer.

In the short span of fifteen minutes (after the initial wait for a server), we had our entrees in front of us...we barely had the opportunity to finish our salads.  Our entrees were quite hot, but the appetizer (potato skins) were not; besides, we had our entrees...we no longer needed or wanted the appetizer.  Our entrees were good, but somewhat bland. 

In passing, our server asked one time "is everything tasting alright" to which our answer went unheard as she scurried away.  She did not return to refill our drinks; she only returned to ask if we wanted boxes and to present our check.  In all fairness, the guy cleaning tables was more diligent and attentive.

I would hope our experience was the result of an unfortunate "off" night for the server/restaurant.  Still, I'm not going to give Springfield Char House another try.  I think 2 stars out of 5 is being generous.
Waited 1 1/2 to find our food order was lost. Steak had no flavor but shrimp was good. Beer was cold.

Simple American fare place with great service. Menu has a lot to choose from. The fried chicken was very good as well as the ribs. Ambience seems a little dated but overall not a bad place. Will go there again.

Good food, could taste every ingredient. Had the Philly, Fries and salad with a sweet tea. Faster food than some fast food places I've been. Place was clean and staff were friendly. Prices were reasonable.

name: Magic Kitchen
address: 4112 N Peoria Rd, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: I think one of the best Thai restaurants anywhere. Dishes aren't as "oily" as many Thai places. Only accept cash, so be prepared, and it's a byob restaurant as they do not have a liquor license. They know how to make dishes hot when requested. I always stop when in town! Smaller menu selection, but awesome Thai traditional favorites!

Staff are friendly. However the food I order (garlic salmon) is very greasy although i like the taste, and come with no vegetables at all, but after request the chef give me extra veggie. Cash and check only, no debit or credit. The price is not expensive. I would give more stars if the food is better. The place has more potential...
Pretty cool place to eat ar. Small and cozy. Awesome food there. Get there early to get a seat
Excellent Thai Basil with shrimp! Chocolate cream pie was also the perfect dessert to follow a lovely meal. The waitress was the sweetest. We will be back, often!
Mengkham, Fish Cake, Tua Nawk-Si Kai, Lemon Grass Soup, Chili Paste Pork.

name: Star 66 Cafe
address: 3752 Camp Butler Rd, Springfield, IL 62707, USA
reviews: Absolutely wonderful. Don’t be alarmed by the location. It is clean!!! Service is wonderful and the menu has a ton of options. I ordered the steak medium. It was probably closer to medium well but not a big deal at all. Loved it.

I've been all over the United States, & No where have I ever had grilled cod, until this morning. 
Or, such fresh tasting sauce in chicken parmesan for dinner last night.

No doubt if I was a local, I'd be here on a regular!!
Good service too... for those passing through,  you owe it to yourself to park, & get ready to enjoy some very, very good food 👍

This is a hidden gem that I was fortunate enough to trip over while traveling for work.

Is attached to a small truck stop and convenience store.  The bathrooms for the convenience store are what is available as a restaurant customer so that's slightly awkward, but no big deal.

It appears to be locally owned and operated by many of the family members.  The menu has a great selection of typical American fare.  The price points are very reasonable.

I ordered a steak dinner, and the steak was cooked a little further than I ordered but was still a pleasant bite.  The soup and sides were good and the portions were fair.  after I had ordered my steak I looked up and saw a specials board that listed pork chops done a half a dozen different ways.  Had I seen that first I would have ordered them instead.

I'm going to have to go back there and try the breakfast sometime!

This place is extremely popular and I can see why.  The portions are extremely generous and you arent going to leave hungry.  Very nice staff and they make you feel right at home.  The food is good, wouldn't say its exceptional, but definitely good.  I tried their Popeye Omelette and enjoyed it.

Great place,  old school style restaurant with the best staff around.  Locals love it for a reason.  The food is great no matter what you order and the service is great as well.  Large portions to fill you up and price isnt bad.

name: Xochimilco Mexican Food
address: 2941 W Iles Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: We have been eating there for years.  With few exceptions (usually when a new cook starts) the food has always been outstanding.  And in those exceptions the management has always done right by us. We will be there for years to come for sure!

Wonderful service, consistently great food.
Excellent margaritas. One of my favorite places to eat.
My family has been going here for a couple years now. Our favorite mexican restaurant in Springfield for sure! Great fajitas, tacos, burritos, margaritas, ect and a friendly staff.
Reasonable Mexican Restaurant in Springfield. Definitely not the best I've had but not bad. Lunch Menu is very good value. Would go back if passing.
Springfield home run for authentic Mexican. The server spoke little English but once we got past that from the margarita to the main course, everything was delicious. Will visit again.

name: Abe's Hideout
address: 2301 S Dirksen Pkwy, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Abe's was great! I had the grilled tenderloin - that's right, not breaded and fried - grilled, and it was delicious! More like eating a steak than a sandwich. I highly recommend it. Also the fried green beans were super tasty. The tomato soup was a little watery, but not enough to knock a star off the rating. All four of us enjoyed our visit, not just because of the food, but the friendly staff as well. Good job Abe's Hideout!

Very nice place that we picked out of the results and reviews. We were on the road back to St Louis from Chicago. The wife had a shrimp basket that she likes very well the fries were great I had a walleye sandwich would I had never had before but it was absolutely delicious. Our server was attentive and friendly we had no issues. We would definitely go back to this place again if we are ever in the area may even make a trip to do so
Warm atmosphere and really good service. Menu has expanded but the I think it would be best to do fewer items better.

I took my team from work out for our holiday lunch. The service was fantastic, there was a wide variety of food options and the price was extremely reasonable. There was plenty of room for us to spread out. We were only a party of ten, so I didn't call ahead but they easily accommodated us.  Amazingly the single waitress for our table kept up and then some with all our food and drink orders and refilled everything so quickly it felt like there were 5 waitresses for our party. Everyone loved the food and I'm so glad we went!
Had a family gathering. It a nice place to have it. We felt comfortable and had good service. The food was delicious. The employees are friendly and helpful to. I would recommend it to anyone.

name: LongHorn Steakhouse - Curbside To Go Available
address: 2451 Wabash Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: The place wasn't super busy except the large group in the back corner that was together. We both got silverware with food stuck to them. Waitress was okay but seemed preoccupied with her cleaning or whatever it was up front. The food took a long time, likely due to the group. My steak was supposed to be medium well, was med rare at best, cool in the center still. Our waitress had vanished again so we asked a guy if he could get her. He turned his head and kept walking. Literally sat looking at a rare steak forever before some random lady asked us if we needed help with it and took ot back to the kitchen to bring it up to temp. Came back in the same condition it left except they had switched out the plate and potato. Brought home a $30 steak for my dog. Won't be back.

Used curbside ordering and ordered Medium, also confirmed 2 times “medium pink center “ when got it it was fully cooked like a piece of wood. Taste was great though, but chewy and low quality. I will give it a chance under normal condition.

Did the call ahead so had a booth waiting for us!  Used a gift card so our splurge was very economical.  We both had steaks, caeser salad, lobster chowder, and a chocolate martini!  Cooked just the way we asked.  I even had leftovers.  Did not get our napkin and silverware until after the bread was being eaten or would have given 5 stars.

How do you have? We had to wait almost 2 hours and got here at 6 pm. We are still here waiting on our food. Do not recommend for a large party. Smaller groups got in and were do eating before we got seated.
Was busy and had to wait a few minutes before we got a table . Service was great . Food was good .

name: La Piazza Cucina Italiana
address: 220 S 6th St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: 1st time here, nice place in downtown Springfield. Staff very friendly. They had a casual side with a few booths and a walk up counter for carry outs. Then the next room is a nice dinning area. 1st impression is good. Seated and given menus, drink orders placed. Menu is nice with the main options being pasta dishes or what appears to be nice hand tossed pizzas. Orders placed, food received. My thoughts as they brought out the salad was they put a lot into a small bowl. The main course looked and tasted really good. As a side note the portion sizes are probably what you should be receiving, a regular size (not large) serving. Food & service was great but not nearly as good as the cannoli cake. Definitely give this place a try.

Definitely worth a visit if you are willing to brave downtown traffic for lunch. The lunch menu was affordable and the portion size was good for the price. The spaghetti and meatballs and cream of potato soup I ordered even came with some delicious fresh baked bread! The thing that topped it all off though was the black cherry gelato I got for a dessert, it was super satisfying and perfect. The staff was super friendly and attentive as well. We intend to come back and try the dinner menu in the future.

I can believe I didn't get any photos but I had a great pizza margarita there.  Very fresh, sauce with mozzarella and basil.  The crust was perfect a little crunchy and chewy.  I was visiting a friend in Springfield and had just stopped in for a quick bite.  I hope to go back and try some pasta and desserts. Promise to get photos next time, LOL.

First time for dinner and was very happy with our selections. I had the lasagna and my husband had the cannelloni; both were excellent! The sauce very much reminded me of my aunt's - delicious. Will definitely return with our family.

I think I should've looked at the pictures rather than read the reviews before going. I was really excited about fig and prosciutto pizza but what I got was a layer of cheese thicker than the crust. And not even cheesy. Really took away from any flavor. The polpette appetizer was good I just wish it was brought out hotter. It was lukewarm. Bread it came with was really really good. The meatballs are the reason this was a 3 and not a 2. Drinks are very reasonably priced. Service was great and friendly.

name: Mekong Cafe
address: 1308 S 2nd St, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews:
I walked here from my hotel on a recommendation from a local.  It was worth the walk!

It was hard to find due to lack of exterior signage, i believe this was due to recent renovation.  Very simple interior.

They did not have their liquor license yet, sonic made due with tea.  Menu was fairly extensive, and I enjoyed everything I ate.  I would definitely recommend.
Love everything I've had here but the wings and mekong fried rice oh my cant stop eating eat

Mekong Cafe is a great place for lunch! Food will be served fast, hot, and it's going to taste great. I've attached pictures of a Red Curry and Crab Rangoon. Both entrees are one of the best in Springfield.

I think I have found my favorite Springfield restaurant. 

Mekong Cafe has a friendly staff, casual atmosphere, and a menu with more variety than you'd expect. 

The food is delicious and whatever you get tastes like what you needed for that moment. 

Mekong Cafe is definitely a restaurant you should check out when in Springfield
Delicious! Everything is made to order! This is a great place for vegans as well!!

name: Sunrise Cafe
address: 1201 S 2nd St, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: I always love my visits to Sunrise Cafe ♡
Great food!  Friendly service!  Food was hot and delicious.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  Good home style meals.  The burgers and fries are really good too.  Good variety to choose from on the menu.
It was a nice family diner. Good food. Nice staff. We had breakfast. Was good.

Decent food, great burgers n most servers are very enjoyable n to work there is mostly great but one person who has been there for a while is allowed to be mean,rude, disrespectful and most of the time is very unpleasant and the management allows for it to go on....... anyone who has been there knows who I am talking about......am I correct?

Good tasting food at a good price; it seems that this is the to go to place in town as it was busy. Food took awhile to arrive and we felt we had to rush for others to be able to seat but overall the meal was savory.

name: Brickhouse Grill & Pub
address: 3136 W Iles Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Better than most pub food. Horseshoes are very good (according to my wife and son). This trip I chose the chopped chef salad and it was great. Pepsi products are only $2 - a rare find these days.  This was our third trip and have never been disappointed.
Try their egg rolls. Crazy good spin on a classic dish. Above average craft beer selection. Convenient location.
Excellent service very good food and reasonable prices.  I had the bacon cheeseburger and homemade chips.  Both were excellent, cooked to perfection and delivered to the table fast and hot.

Brickhouse is a very popular place to dine in or just have a few drinks. The atmosphere is very active and upbeat. The food is great... every time I have eaten there I have been happy with my order. 😊
I can't forget to mention the wait staff, which has been nothing but excellent, even when the place is hopping. I would definitely go back and suggest that you check them out too.
Food very tasty, great cocktails, fast service.

name: Nu-Voh at the Saint Nicholas
address: 400 E Jefferson St, Springfield, IL 62701, USA
reviews: Amazing lunch menu. Different! Been there multiple times and every meal has been excellent. Love the ambiance

Worst meal ever on New Year's Eve. We had a reservation for a group of 10 @7pm, flags should have been raised when it appeared as if there was only one bartender.  We were seated at our table which had no place settings and was served water immediately, shortly after, our waiter took drink orders. It took quite some time to be served our drinks since the room was starting to fill up with other diners.  We had a limited menu to order from which is understandable on an anticipated busy night.  Once we were served, we had no butter or sour cream on the table for anyone's baked potatoes, no salt and pepper and one meal of pork chops was served completely raw inside. The pork was sent back, and other meals had steamed veggies that were more raw than steamed. 
It appeared for whatever reason the place was understaffed.  Our waiter did try to take care of us but appeared as if he was being rushed. The manager comped the one meal that was sent back. We were disappointed in this visit as it was the 1st time most of us have been here. We are understanding enough to give them another chance for another visit on an evening with no special events.
Expensive. Steaks were good but over priced compared to elsewhere in town. Cesar salad was funky and not at all classic taste. Atmosphere was ok but too bright.
Biggest lobster tail I've ever had && so delicious!

Was a great atmosphere! Sat at the Blu bar during happy hour, was not very busy but service was great. 
Ordered soup and an appetizer and both were delicious. Fast service! 
Will definitely be back!

name: Hawaiian BBQ
address: 2355 W Monroe St, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: They have some really good food. Staff is friendly and food comes fast. What else do you want more
We love eating here. The food is the best in Asian food Springfield. It is our favorite place to have Pad Thai and the Korian dish Bulgogie. Our family can't wait till you re-open!

Dining alone as the wife is babysitting. The name is somewhat misleading it is more oriented to Asian Thai food. Food here is prepared fresh upon ordering. Place is on the smaller size very clean with pleasing decor. Staff is friendly and outgoing. I have enjoyed this place on numerous occasions and have never not had a good experience with the dishes I've tried. Delicious.

First time here but my sister and her husband loved there food first . Walking in it's nice the walls make you feel like your in Hawaii and the smell of the good is yummy . Having tried Pad tai in many locations this definitely had good pad tai well seasoned hot and spicey . You can pick what spice level you want too and it actually comes out how you request . The pho is great and well portioned and flavorful as well . The appetizers are so food as well we got crab rangoon which  where nice and cheesy with crab meat and the dumbling  where to die for!! The pad tai rolls where crunchy and came with sauce to dip them in and oh so yummy. I have to say I will be returning here next time I'm in the area!!
Was really good. Had order carried out. Had it done in 10 mins

name: Anchors Away
address: 518 E Capitol Ave, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews:
This was our first time here.  Right from the start she told us how you order.  If you never been there, ask for help!  It makes a difference.  She was extremely helpful.

You pick your seafood (shrimp, snow or king crab, mussels, etc), pick a side, pick your boil and then pick your spice.  Spice I highly recommend Anchors Away as it was just enough hotness you need that doesnt over power the food.

While we had our drinks, she gave us a sample of grits.  I am not a grit-guy but tried it anyway, but boy theirs was great!

As you see below, everything is served in a bag.  Expect it to be messy!!!  Normally I see it in a bucket or in a net, but I like this idea as it still marinates in the bag.

The food was awesome.  I had the shrimp and snow crabs.  Now it is my favorite seafood place.  No parking in front of place but there is other street parking and a huge parking garage on the east side.

Fat Tuesday is coming up so that will be fun to enjoy.

We arrived at 6:20 pm. We Ordered an appetizer and 4 meals. We waited almost an hour for the appetizer and sat for an additional hour without being served our meals. During these two hours our waiter failed to say two words to us or explain what was taking so long. We watched people who arrived after us eat and leave. So we got up and left to get dinner elsewhere. Then our waiter decided he better come actually speak to us, just to scream down the street he was calling the cops if we didn’t pay for our 6 alligator bites we ordered as an appetizer. We walked back inside to give him 12 dollars but we will never ever be going back. The discount we deserved for waiting 2 hours without hardly being looked at by the staff should have been worth well over 12 dollars. Awful service. Possibly worst service I’ve ever gotten at an eating establishment.

We went as a group of 6. Everyone tried a different item. From frog legs to crab... shrimp to oysters... everyone loved the food. Prices were reasonable.  Service was good. Too bad the Municipal League next door are such bad neighbors. Parking is challenging but worth a one block walk.

Great food choices and delicious meals.  Kind servers and attentive. Gumbo pictured was slightly spicy, which was exactly what I wanted. My wife ordered the shrimp and grits and it was amazing. A must visit for those in the area.
First time...nice and pleasant atmosphere. Food was good. I will definitely be back to try other dishes on the menu.

name: Finley's Tap House
address: 3236 Ginger Creek Dr, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: Had a delicious meal at Finley's this evening.  (I recommend the meatloaf.)  Our server, Jessica, took good care of us.   I highly recommended Finley's for its good food, warm inviting atmosphere, and excellent service.  The 5-star rating is well deserved!

We've eaten here at least a half dozen times, this time for a late lunch. We both started with side salads which were fresh. My wife had a margherita  flatbread pizza that was large enough to take half of it home. I had the prime rib with mashed potatoes and southwest corn.  It was good but a little too well done for my taste. I didn't send it back, not wanting to waste it. Dessert was a delicious chocolate that we shared. We had an excellent server.

Enjoyed a flight and other drinks. They had a nice mix of options, wish they had a few more varieties given the name. As a vegan, not much to enjoy on the food menu. Staff was very nice and attentive.

Meal was great.  Service was great....until one of our party went to the men's room while waiting for the check.  While he was there, a busboy emerged from a stall, CARRYING a tray full of dishes, and left the restroom without washing his hands.   Pointed the busboy out and complained to the waitress who promised to speak to a manager.  At least one other customer witnessed this.

We won't be back.

Way beyond bar food. Great service too, but one of my pet peeves kept this from being 5 stars. If you're going to suggest things like dipping sauces, extra dessert for people having birthdays, etc., mention the upcharge. I don't like surprises on my bill.
I am still going back though. Food is too good not to.

name: Mariahs Steakhouse and Pasta
address: 3317 Robbins Rd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Wonderful food! Great waitstaff.  Fast service. Only negative? Sounds from Video poker in front lobby was a bit distracting.
Touted as the Best Brunch in Springfield! A little pricey, good food, especially the prime rib and light & fluffy bread pudding. Couldn't eat enough.
Great local eatery.  Has specials for carryout when we need it. Support local

Absolutely perfect.  The owner and staff made us feel welcomed and special.  The food was exceptional.  Well prepared.. well presented.. and tasted great.  If you want good food and a good experience... Mariahs hits the target.

I have eaten here twice the first time we went we had absolutely great service and a delicious dinner. I truly enjoyed having dinner here so much that when I saw they were having a thanksgiving buffet and I hate buffets I wanted to spend our Thanksgiving Day meal here. So glad we did. It exceeded my expectations.

name: Happy Sushi
address: 846 S Grand Ave E, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic food! The egg rolls are second to none, and the sushi is amazing! Place is small, but the food is well worth going there for! If you like Sushi, you will not want to go anywhere else for it again!

Being from an urban area, the atmosphere brought us back to some of the places we regularly visited in our younger years. The itamae is definitely a sushi master. He is creative but maintains a balance in his pieces. The French Kiss roll is delightfully refreshing with a slight lemon pucker inside. The Sunny roll has a hint of sweetness from the mango while still being a savory roll. The tempura rolls are crunchy. The rice is tender. And the hostess, Jessica, provides a calming spirit to a busy restaurant. It was our anniversary and the chef sent us a complementary appetizer, which was a thoughtful surprise. We will definitely return and I might stop in just for the House Salad, with a creamy ginger house dressing.

Best sushi place in Springfield! Honestly we were surprised! We are sushi lovers and find sushi places in any city. I found Happy Sushi in yelp as 4.5 stars, they deserve it. Good for their business! Pick yummy and anger management rolls! They rock!

If you read my reviews, you know I’m into sushi. This is by far my favorite place to get sushi in Springfield. It definitely has that hole in the wall vibe, but the sushi is divine. Also try the heart attack jalapeño appetizer. That was surprisingly really good.
They added some new dishes since their last break . Amazing food. The staff is friendly, attentive,and outgoing. Definitely worth it.

name: Taqueria Moroleon
address: 1101 S 9th St, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: OUTSTANDING FOOD!!! Absolutely delicious from the first bite to the last.  Very nice and personable servers.  A place to relax and eat after visiting Lincoln's home and neighboring sites in Springfield, IL.

Excellent food and atmosphere.  Perfect little place to get some authentic Mexican cuisine.  Don't miss this little gem, it may be a small location but the food and service are big. Best chips around (in my opinion) crispy and flaky. So if you're looking for a nice local spot for Mexican this is your ticket. Hope this helps!
Excellent margaritas, 4 different kinds of salsas brought immediately to the table. Home made guacamole! I had just two tacos n was filled up! Excellent cute little place
Great chips and salsa (four kinds, but you had me at chipotle!) Chicken fajita nachos are huge and absolutely delicious. Big menu--I suppose I will have to go back more than once!

Great spot for lunch....
As a first timer...  my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the service and food! If you want an authentic experience with Mexican food... this is the place!!!

name: Bella Milano Springfield
address: 4525 Wabash Ave, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: I took my best friend today for the curbside pickup for lunch. It was her first visit to Bella Milano. I ordered my all time favorite the Chicken Gouda and she had the kids hamburger with bacon and cheese. As she was eating she couldn’t help but say “Oh my goodness I need to report a robbery, they just stole my heart.” 5 stars for the great food and service. Thanks for all that you guys do there at Bella Milano :)

Let me start with the service was excellent.  That’s about all that was good here. We came down from Chicago to check out Springfield and were looking for some good Italian food.  This was a swing and a miss. Our appetizer calamari was greasy chewy and flavorless, the presentation was terrible as well.
