Our salads were over dressed and soggy, though if the texture wasn’t horrible, the taste profile was actually decent.  They give you some store bought bread and oil with cheese. The oil tasted like vegetable oil, it had no flavor it was awful.  My entree was chicken Marsala, it was nothing even close to Marsala, bland and flavorless it was a half chicken breast cutlet cut in half.. $22 for a half a chicken breast is crazy.     All that said the pasta carbonara was actually good. Maybe they’re good at pasta, but everything else was less than mediocre.

We made reservations here for a celebratory dinner. It was busy, but we were seated promptly. My wife had a vegetarian pasta, and I ordered sea bass and scallops. My wife had soup; I had a small Milano salad. Both were excellent, as were our entrees. It's easy to overcook fish,  but it was perfect. Our server was exceptionally good although she had a seemingly large number of tables. It's always a pleasure to dine here, and this was no exception.

I have been here several times. The food is good and the service is also good. The toasted ravioli is really yummy. 

There is a lunch menu that has less expensive prices of you go at lunch time. 

It's a pretty big space that has lots of room for dinners and the parking lot had room for all the cars.

Went on Monday and they had $5 drinks and appetizers. So I got to have  toasted ravioli for less money.

We did not have reservations and the wait was 30-40 minutes, not bad for a Friday night. We ordered mixed drinks and they were very good. When we ordered we were asked if we refer soup or salad so we made our choices. We did not know this wasn’t included in the meal price until we got the ticket and it was an added charge. The food was very good. We were first timers so the general manager came and talked to us and gave us a voucher good for a free pasta dish in the future. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Food was very good and the restaurant was very clean even though they were very busy.

name: Parkway Cafe
address: 2715 N Dirksen Pkwy, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: My mom and I stood there for 7-9 minutes with no acknowledgement by staff. There was a mother and son ahead of us and they had been there for a while before we got there. So we waited and when not acknowledged after a while went elsewhere. There were a lot of people, but there were open tables,  there so I am thinking the food must be good. It may have been a fluke as there was no one at the register/host area... we will try it again and if better will update this review.

Chicken  salad on lettuce with tomatoes and in house ranch dressing. I'm from out of town but the chicken salad had too much celery. It wasn't bad but not a favorite. My husband ordered a horseshoe,  this is a local favorite,  it's one reason we ate here. This one is delicious! We went here to eat with locals. Family members have been eating here for years.

Wonderful northend cafe good food good service. I have not tired everything on the menu because there is a lot to choose from, breakfast anytime is awesome , so i  had breakfast for dinner, an ultimate  Omelet with with America potatoes with peppers and o onions 
It was delish
A wonderful experience everytime my wife and I are in there. The staff are the best. Thanks to all.
Nice caring staff. Breakfast is always great here.

name: AZ-T-CA Mexican Grill
address: 2753 Chatham Rd, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: Had carry out delivered to our car by the owner. He is so kind and courteous. The food is mind blowingly good! Also I'm so proud of our local restaurants fir helping out the community!
Really liked the flavor here, split a street taco platter. Very uniquely different. Overall food was right on par for being perfect in taste.
I have never had such a bad Mexican food before. I think everything came out of a can or a box. My daughter ordered a margarita and she said it tasted like Kool-Aid. I won't be returning.
First time at this restaurant. Have to say it has to be the best Mexican food is town. If you go try the power bowl it was amazing!!! Good service and friendly staff will be my go to from now on.
Best Latin food in town. Out of the ordinary fare. Quality cuisine!

name: Cook's Spice Rack & Chili
address: 910 N Grand Ave W, Springfield, IL 62702, USA
reviews: We ate breakfast here. Cozy, yummy, fun decor. Lots of veggies on the menu, which was not expected, and they can accommodate those on gluten-free diets. Very reasonable prices. Our waiter had a great sense of humor. I found the food to be .... bland. The service and atmosphere were good, though.

We first had their food at the Visions by JDR Holistic Fair at the Illinois State Fair Grounds. I feel in love with their chili, the Terlingua Red Chili is delicious.  We try to stop in when we are in the area. Goldie and the rest of the staff treat guest like family.  We had the Sweet Potato tots, I had Black Pot chili dog with shredded cheese and chips It was more than I could eat in one meal) and my husband had Hamburger Horseshoe with yellow and white cheese (he said it was soooo gooood!)
I love that you can get lunch for breakfast.   Great fried chicken.  The Salisbury steak is really good too.

It's nice and very friendly family restaurant. We were there at Sunday night, that's their  family dinner night. Food was tasty, the owner was very nice and honestly. We may go back try their normal menu, we was told by another customer their chill is very good in town.
Had a great experience here. Food was excellent especially the chili and those fall-off-the-bone smoked ribs. Service was wonderful. We're looking forward to another visit soon.

name: Taste of Thai Restaurant
address: 3053 S Dirksen Pkwy, Springfield, IL 62703, USA
reviews: Best Thai food around! I get the beef Pad See Yew and have never been disappointed.
great place for dinner if staying at a hotel near S.Dirksen. Padthai w/shrimp is a winner
Excellent food. I've been eating here since I was a kid. Love love love their food.

I’ve been coming here since I was little, and it’s only gotten better. My family and I are good friends with the staff, they joke around with us, they give excellent service, and they make it an amazing experience every time we go.
Had chicken basil Thai ...tasted fowl... Price is cheap so as the food quality...

name: Gateway To India
address: 3115 Chatham Rd #5306, Springfield, IL 62704, USA
reviews: I had a horrible experience at this restaurant. The service was terrible and racist. My date and I are both Black and it was very apparent that the poor service we received was racially motivated. The rest of the patrons in the restaurant were White and received better service than us. I made a reservation hours in advance, but it took them at least 10 minutes to get a table prepared for us, despite the fact that multiple tables were open and we arrived 10 minutes before the time of our reservation. The table they prepared was located in the back corner of the restaurant between the exit door and one of the windows. It was very cold and the most secluded spot in the restaurant. There were other tables for two available, but the waiter chose to seat us there. After taking us to our seat, the waiter served us water and did not offer any other drinks. Also, we were not given any snacks while waiting for our food. Patrons who came after us were given these snacks while waiting for their food. The waiter took 10 minutes to give us menus despite having ample time to do so. This would have been somewhat understandable had there been many people in the restaurant at the time, but that was not the case. After giving us menus, the waiter took another 15 minutes to check on us about our order. It took 50 minutes for our food to arrive at the table. We both ordered simple main course dishes that did not require any kind of special preparations. At least three other tables with patrons that arrived after us received their food before we did. Our visit to this restaurant lasted around two hours, and we were checked on only once, not including the mandatory visits the waiter made to our table to give us our menus, food, and the check. The rest of the patrons were checked on regularly. I always tip at restaurants, but I did not give a tip on this occasion due to my awful experience. I will never return to this restaurant, nor will I ever recommend others to visit it, especially people of color.

Nice restaurant buffet, very kind owners. Super clean restaurant. Staff very attentive. The food is very tasty and designed for Vegans, options for Vegetarians and carnivores. All the food is very well marked and the owner is ready to answer any questions. They have a Vegan Festival in April and other Vegan events throughout the year.

Catered our daughter's wedding and the food was delicious. Many of the people were from out of town and even out of country. All enjoyed the selection. Grateful for their friendly, laid-back demeanor. Their restaurant is the go-to place for Indian cuisine in Springfield.

This is by far the best place to go out to dinner in Springfield. The atmosphere is amazing, the staff is excellent, and the food... THE FOOD IS BEYOND AMAZING. Check out the lunch buffet as well, it's worth every penny and then some. If I could rate more than 5 stars i would. Bravo Gateway.
Great food. Confused servers. They forgot to bring white rice with a couple dishes. Also ordered a bottle of Cabernet. Smooth

name: Fox Run Restaurant and Lounge
address: 1130 Legacy Pointe Dr, Springfield, IL 62711, USA
reviews: Went for the 217 hamburger special.  It was a delicious burger.  Would have given 5 stars but we waited quite a while to get our order taken.  But after that all was good!  And when I called in the afternoon had an exceptional gal on the phone.  She was super nice!
Great food good service great atmosphere. I recommend getting onion rings for an appetizer.
Excellent service. Great food.

Waitress was nice, but almost never came back to the table to check on us. Disappeared after paying even though my family stayed to chat. Horseshoe fries were cold and the tater tots were warm, making it obvious that they weren't made at the same time. Fries were old and inedible. The cheese sauce was frothy, and the tenderloin was chewy and over seasoned.

Nice place. Happy hour for apps. Beer garden. Clean. We had a party of 12 with all sorts of needs (seperate checks, coupled checks, I'll get his drink, food only, drink only, food and drink) and everything was spot on. Our waitress Casey was great.
